Imagine a croissant as a cupcake with passion fruit cream filling. That's sort of what this doughp is. The passion fruit filling is really tasty and its acidity cuts through the sweetness of the dough (not that the sweetness is a bad thing). These usually sell out early. 

Overall, this place is awesome. I highly recommend it to anyone who likes baked goods. And even if you don't, you still won't be disappointed. The quality is so good, you'll be able to taste the difference between other places.

Also!, make sure to come early because they start selling out of certain items a little after noon. Go eat and enjoy.
author: Mario Z.

description:
So this place has been revered as better than Tartine and I will have to say Tartine's baked goods are better [more variety and their oh my gawd banana creme pie!!]; but Neighbor Bakehouse's line is AMAZING. It is maybe 1/10th's of Tartine so it's nice to just come, grab your pastry, and immediately bite into some tasty goodness.

I will have to say that their double baked pistachio croissant is oh my gawd delicious though. So I'll be back.

Def. worth the trip!
author: Christina C.

description:
I love this place! I was recently in SF for a workshop at El Niño Training Center down the road and I had breakfast and lunch here both days!!! The service is amazing! All the team members are so friendly and positive! They were more than happy to talk me through the menu, and also give me recommendations of what to do while visiting the city.

The butter croissants are very light and flavorful, the Oat, Pecan, and Choc Chip Cookies are awesome! The cold brew coffees definitely have a kick, but the espressos are top shelf!
author: Anthony B.

description:
Incredible. The twice baked pistachio and blackberry croissant was incredible. The chocolate pull apart was also worth trying.

I am upset it has taking me so long to check this place out. Racks of fresh baked goods are on display. You walk up and can see them working their magic in the kitchen.

Easy to get to via muni or car, with street parking on 3rd. Did I mention this place is incredible?
author: EM S.

description:
Gosh, I love this place. My wife and I moved to the north side of Potrero Hill several years ago and we've been waiting for a "destination" bakery to finally land nearby. Neighbor Bakehouse is our wish granted, though NB is even better than the other, big name bakeries in San Francisco in that it's still a bit of an up-and-comer and it's location in the sleepy Dogpatch makes it a bit less of a madhouse on Saturday mornings. :-)

My wife's baby shower was this past weekend and I wanted to surprise the party with a bunch of delicious baked goods. I procrastinated on placing the order but NB was able to come through for me anyway, and on extremely short notice! Everything was delicious, as expected. The Everything Croissant is to die for!
author: Andrew V.

description:
Most of their pastries are variations of croissant dough. Loved the ginger pull apart (similar to monkey bread) and almond bostock. Was less impressed with the ham/cheese croissant and the custard buns. 

Prices are more reasonable than what Tartine and B.Patisserie charges. Easier parking, too! Definitely will come back to try their other offerings. 

Wish they had more desserts like cakes, etc. I'm sure they would be awesome. :)
author: Jen K.

description:
Q: What do I love more than good food and friendly service?
A: Good food + friendly service within walking distance!!!

Neighbor bakehouse is literally in my neighborhood!  Baked goods are AH-MAZING!  Yes, so good that I'm spelling it incorrectly!  my failed attempt at being cute...

What we've ordered thus far:
+  Manchego & Mushroom, 4.5 stars
+  Cheese & Spicy Kraut, 4.5 stars
+  Savory morning bun, 4 stars (need more ham in it)
+  Ginger pull apart, 5 stars
+  Chocolate Croissant, 4 stars
+  Hazelnut Brown Butter Cake, 4 stars
+  Bostock w/Almond Frangipani, 5 stars

They now accept credit cards and have larger bags.  My first time there, I had 8 little bags that I had to carry separately!  :) Yes, I over order...

They close early, 12:30ish and some items are known to run out, go early!

Happy eating!
author: Tina F.

description: yummmm!! everything here is delicious, and that is everything i need to say!
author: Christina L.

description:
Holy smokes. I almost don't want to share the wealth so that this place doesn't end up the way of Mr. Holmes' A.K.A. The Place of Monstrous Lines. 

I had the savory ham and cheese morning bun with a De La Paz drip coffee. The absolute perfect start to my Friday.

The morning bun is rolled in chia, sesame, and sunflower seeds to give it some nice texture and crunch. The shaved ham inside is distributed evenly so you get ham and cheese in every bite. When I bit into the middle to see just HOW they got the right cheese to pastry ratio, it was spread in an even layer all around the middle. Not the mention the pastry itself was beautiful: a perfect spiral like a conch shell.

The coffee was reasonable at $2.50 for the cup, and the blend was delicious.

I only wish this place was open more days a week, and for longer hours. But for now I will settle for stocking up on an ungodly amount of pastries for the week and returning on Friday mornings to get new loot.
author: Bianca P.

description: My colleague shared this place and brought me an everything croissant.  I am absolutely in love with this tasty savory treat.  A true GEM!
author: Kim Y.

description: Everything here is amazing. Lots of oddball croissant-inspired pastries -- some savory, some sweet, all delicious. The Ginger Pull-Apart lives up to the hype and tastes like a perfectly-baked kouign-amann (like, Dominique Ansel perfect) with perky ginger notes. Was also very impressed with the Everything Croissant, which is coated with perfectly-toasted seeds and filled with some kind of cream cheese. I wish they had late-day pastries so I didn't have to wake up at 7 to get the good stuff!
author: Alexei B.

description:
I was feeling unsure about this place as it was a bit out of the way but my pastry senses told me otherwise.
The staff were pretty friendly and attentive, and after I decided on my many choices, they quickly bagged everything and I waited outside for my coffee. I enjoyed my ham and cheese bun on the tables out front and was very impressed with the quality. Great texture and flavour from the pastry and the coffee was great too.
It's basically an open bakery with a coffee machine and till set up so you can see them making everything.
The ginger pull-apart was amazing, personally I'd like more ginger though. Every pastry i had was really well done and I'd highly recommend this to anyone that loves a good pastry.
author: Adam J.

description:
Really good! We got the ginger pull, coffee cake, and pistachio croissant. All were  flaky, buttery, soft on the inside. The ginger pull was our favorite, with the middle being soft and gooey with the ginger jelly, but not overly sweet.

The inside is a typical hipster looking kind of scenery. Lots of people running around making fresh baked goods.

They have lemon water and tables outside for customers.
author: Em F.

description: Went this past weekend for the first time because my mom and I were in the area. We love Tartine and wanted to try out another bakery in SF, so we tried this out. We got several items including the smoked fish croissant, everything croissant, passionfruit macaroon, passionfruit doughnut thing, and the raspberry hazelnut pastry too! Everything was lovely and we would definitely go again. :)
author: Joweina H.

description: We've been waiting in a long line to pick up items we preordered for Thanksgiving.  They certainly don't have their act together to handle the line even though they know exactly how many preorders were placed.  The baked goods are good but not good enough to ever preorder from them again.
author: shaul t.

description:
Got here a little before closing and there was only 4 different kinds of pastries left. Tried the Chocolate Croissant, twice baked Pistachio Blackberry Croissant, Ham & Cheese morning bun.  Everything was delicious - croissants here are flakey and crispy and soft buttery inside.  The Pistachio Blackberry Croissant is definitely worth coming back for.  

It's a small shop with a couple tables outside and no parking in front.
author: Yolanda G.

description: We found this bakery via Yelp and yes the reviews are true! My favorites so far are the ginger pull apart and the  pistachio/blackberry croissant!
author: Michelle M.

description:
Pastry good! Must eat them all...

Seriously, the croque madame is by far my favorite. Also, the kraut and cheese pastry is very good.
Full coffee menu.
Limited outdoor seating.
Order line can be about 10 minutes but moves quickly
author: Jeffrey O.

description: WOW! I have been wanting to come here forever -- a 5 star bakery on yelp, I figured it had to be good. And it was! Wow. We tried a warm out of the oven berry tart which was excellent. We also tried a berry twice baked croissant which was a-mazing! Can't wait to come back and try more!
author: Jen G.

description: Absolutely delicious. The only con is that this is really out of my way. Despite that, I went back the next day. I plan on being a regular.
author: Nathan C.

description: Love this place! Really good pastries and loaves of bread. The staff is extremely friendly. We arrived after the posted closing time and they still let us in. I would recommend over Tartine.
author: Jayme F.

description:
They have flat-out the best croissants/flaky pastries I've ever had, and I'm someone who goes out of her way to try every chocolate croissant at every bakery in whatever city I visit.

Go, stand in line, get whatever you can, and enjoy! 

Their sourdough bread loaves are also fantastic.
author: Lucia C.

description:
I have a really special love for neighbor bakehouse. This business encompasses everything I support for sustainable, delicious, and ethical business practices. The owners are lovely people who care about the community and employees - but also making their #1 priority : quality baked goods. So yum!

Everything that comes out of this place is scrumptious and HIGHLY addictive. From the crusty sourdough loaves to the passion fruit 'dough-p nuts' blasting with flavor and buttery/flakey pastry...everything is a must. Seriously though, if you have to get ONE thing: get the dough-p nut. The savory croissants and tarts are really really good too.

There's normally a line but it moves very quickly, the operations seem to be very seamless which is a good thing, its all out in an open setting for everyone scope out while waiting to pick up their favorites. Parking may be a little hassle, but I never have a problem just driving my mini cart right up to the front :)

Seating and coffee bar outside in front. Cute little bakery in the Dogpatch. Go early!
author: nina B.

description: I recommend the ginger pull-apart, croissant, and the guava cheese tart. The pastries are delightfully buttery and flaky. So delicious, I would love to come back soon!
author: Tes Y.

description: Loved the croissants we got! So fresh and delicious!! and they have a cute little outdoorsy area!
author: Dominique F.

description: I come here for the mushroom tart and croissants. Small place with only outside bench seating but worth the visit.  Seeing the fresh baked goods come out of the oven is such a sensory delight.
author: Alvin C.

description: The butteriness of the pastries fully reminds me of Paris.  Thanks for holding the line on price--meaning just about everything sub $5.   Friendly staff all around.  Agree with everybody else that this is a top flight neighborhood gem.
author: Randy P.

description:
Tiny little bakery with 3 parking spots in front, and a few small tables outside (no indoor seating). Parking tends to be difficult to find in this area though.

*~Menu on 1/2/2015~*
--Sweet--
+Butter Croissant: $3
+Valrhona Chocolate Chocolate Claw: ($3.75) croissant made with Valrhona chocolate
+Pistachio Blackberry Twice Baked Croissant: ($4) twice-baked croissant soaked in vanilla syrup, filled w/ blackberry jam & pistachio cream, topped w/ pistachio and powdered sugar
+Ginger Pull-apart: ($3.75) flaky croissant caramelized w/ fresh ginger, cane sugar, dark brown sugar
+German Coffee Cake w/ Seasonal Fruit: ($4) seasonal fruit, vanilla custard, and streusel atop a sweet brioche (currently: apple & cherry)
+Cinnamon Bostock with Almond Frangipani: ($4) Slice of cinnamon croissant dough loaf, soaked in vanilla syrup, baked again w/ almond frangipane
+Walnut Chocolate Crumb Cake: ($3.50) house-made creme fraiche, studded with toasted walnuts, Valrhona chocolate, and swirled with a crumb mixture of cocoa nib, cane sugar, toasted walnuts, and maldon salt, topped w/ a cocoa nib streusel
+Brown Butter Hazelnut Frinancier w/ Candied Orange Peel: ($3.50)
+Guava Cheese Pastelito: ($2) guava and cream cheese in puff pastry
+Chocolate Pecan Coconut Oat Cookie: ($2.75)
+Raspberry Lime Coconut Macron: ($2) No Gluten. Coconut macaroon made w/ raspberry & lime

--Savory--
+Smoked Salmon Croissant: ($4)
+Mushroom Green Onion Manchego Tart: ($3.50) Mushrroms, béchamel, manchego cheese, and green onion baked atop a croissant
+Seasonal Veggie Tart: ($4) seasonal produce, goat & manchega cheese, béchamel sauce, seeds (currently: delicata squash & kale)
+Sauerkraut Smoked Cheddar Peppadew Tart: ($3.50) flaky croissant dough latticed over house-made sauerkraut, smoked cheddar, and sweet & spicy peppadew peppers
+Ham and Cheese Morning Bun: ($4.25) Fra'mani smoked little ham baked with gruyere cheese and mustard wrapped in croissant dough with sunflower and poppy seeds
+Chorizo Tart: ($4) Chorizo, caramelized onions, green onions and manchego cheese
+Everything Croissant: ($3.50) croissant filled w/ cream cheese & green onion topped w/ everything bagel toppings (poppy, sesame, garlic, onion and sea salt)
+Madame... croque: ($5.98)

*~My Order~*
Chocolate Chocolate Claw
Pistachio Blackberry Twice Baked Croissant
Bostock with Almond Frangipani
Chorizo Tart
Smoked Salmon Croissant
Madame... croque
Ham and Cheese Morning Bun
Guava Cheese Pastelito
Ginger Pull-apart

Had a friend visiting and I had to wake up early to run some errands in the city. Wanted to grab some pastries for everyone and stopped by since I've had this place bookmarked since their soft-opening. I'm a huge pastry person and was told that they make some great croissant pastries, so I was sold! I told the gentleman there that it was my 1st time there and to recommend some popular items. I got a dozen pastries and a line quickly started to form behind me. The gentleman assisting me never rushed me and still placed all the goodies very nicely in the box instead of just throwing them inside. Very greatly appreciated! Pastries were very light, airy, and didn't have the insane buttery-feel left on your lips after eating. My BF and my sister's BF who usually don't care for pastries as much as we do thought the goodies were really good. Highly recommended!

Credit cards accepted
author: Kitty K.

description:
No ordinary bakery here, 

Greg puts his signature into everything he bakes.  Amazing savory and sweet pastries including an everything croissant with poppy seeds, garlic, green onion and cream cheese, along with a delicious smoked cheddar and sauerkraut pastry, but here you can't go wrong with any selection.   I should also mention that the best blueberry muffin I have ever had was made by him as well.
author: Adam B.

description: Delicious baked goods and exceptionally friendly service - what a combination! I couldn't pick a favorite, even between sweet and savory (really happy that they offer the latter). I have heard that the bostock is the thing to have, but I'm not wild about almond, so I opted for some others. The ham and cheese morning bun was definitely a winner. The ginger pull-apart had a great texture but was too gingery for me (which isn't saying much). Can't wait to go back!
author: Lisa K.

description: Always happy to come here! It has the tiniest storefront ever, which means everyone paying and waiting to order is crammed together, but they have a cute little seating area outside. They have an incredible selection of sweet and savory pastries, and their coffee is always good. We typically go for the Blackberry Pistachio Croissant or the Ginger Pull-Apart. The Croque Madame is also very good, but it's a little strange that it's served cold.
author: Alysha V.

description:
Basically the BEST bakery on earth - I don't even write Yelp reviews anymore but felt compelled as I sink my teeth into the Croque Madame I ordered this morning.  Whenever I come visit my family in the Bay Area I make a special trip out to basically order one of everything at Neighbor Bakehouse.  Been here a few times and I'm obsessed with the Croque Madame, Kimchi Toast, the Bostock and today I finally got to try the Ginger Pull Apart which was always sold out when I got there.

I'm officially a diehard Neighbor Bakehouse believer.  I mean, I would move here and move next door just so I could go here every day.  Nowadays I don't even bother going to Tartine cause everything here is so much better and consistently DELICIOUS.  The ginger pull apart is sooooo flaky and crispy and buttery it's like pastry heaven.  I mean, this place has over 300 reviews and is still a solid 5 stars.  I don't know what else I can add to this.  I don't think there's one thing here that I don't like.  They don't actually have THAT much stuff, but whenever I go I feel the need to order everything so it ends up being a lot.  Definitely get there early and make sure you're buying for a group so you can share and split stuff.  I got there at 7:30am and most everything was there - i've been there a few times at 10-11am ish and stuff would run out already. Wish there was something even 1/10th as good in NYC!
author: Biqi C.

description: Omg! It's heavenly. The pistachio pastry is fantastic. It's magic and heaven in one bite.
author: Marcela M.

description: This place rocks!  Just when you were getting tired of the same old same old at Tartine (sorry Chad, but we crave a little variety), Neighbor Bakehouse comes to the rescue!  Same great quality, but a whole new twist on everything to rekindle your love of Tartine style baked goods (same complex breads, same heavenly overly LAMINATED DOUGH). This place is doing for Croissants, what bagel shops have done for bagels for years.... use a perfected vehicle and twist it in to all different awesome flavors. Let's hope the Chipotle style ordering menu will never appears on these walls. Everything I had here was awesome, but the croissant variants standout (see picture).
author: John H.

description:
5 stars because after trying several of their pastries, I had the same reaction every time!!!--and that is absolutely heavenly delicious!!! 

Pistachio blackberry twice-baked croissant??! Whoever thought of this recipe is pure genius. Just the perfect amount of flaky,  bit of crunchy outside, with a marriage of a light pistachio and sweet blackberry flavor inside. Definitely advise to eat fresh! 

They have a well-rounded selection of sweet&savory pastries, and when you ask what they are, they'll spew out all these ingredients and how they are baked. Goes to show that there's a lot of thought and care going into baking these!
author: Karen C.

description: We enjoy coming here on weekends. Possibly my favoritest bakery in the neighborhood!
author: Christina C.

description:
I live in New York, so it pains me to say that I'll have to wait for the next time I come back to SF for a visit before I can get in line for these pastries again. 

There's always a line out the tiny establishment in the mornings, but the wait isn't long at all. I would really recommend trying the Croque Madame, it's basically a small meal on its own. Their Buttered Croissants are solid too, but honestly most of their desserts are probably amazing. 

There's a couple benches and tables arranged right outside the door for people to sit and eat their food outdoors. Charming.
author: Hope X.

description:
This place doesn't need more reviews, but here we go...

Amazing:
Everything croissant (get an extra one, you won't regret it)
Mushroom tart (big enough to share) 

They do preorders too! You email them your order, desired time you want the order ready by, they send you an invoice and you pay online. Then you just skip the line and go up to the front to pick up your order.  So easy!

Parking was easy to find on weekends, but you can take Muni there too. Line moves quick.
author: Ann L.

description:
Wow, this is some amazing baking.  I tried the hazelnut brown butter cake and the savory vegetable tart/pastry.  Both were pretty damn awesome.  I was surprised the vegetable one was so good for something that had some healthy stuff in it.

Oh. and make sure you know the address of this place.  When I went (4/25/15) there was no sign on the exterior of the building for this business and I walked right past it.
author: Bob F.

description:
I am pretty sure I spent wayyyy too much here. My friend and I were on a date when we walked by this place with a long line. We figured it MUST be good for all these people to line up for it. 

So we go in and find all these amazingly creative and fresh pastries that you really can't get anywhere else! I tried their passion fruit, pistachio, chocolate, morning bun, etc.... Pretty much everything! It was definitely the best incidental find for sure.

Pricing is cheap too! I bought maybe a dozen of pastries for about 30 or less which for these creative and delicious selections... totally worth it!
author: Tiffany T.

description: Finally made it to this place when it was open. The pastries are all fresh and the staff is friendly. -1 star for the smoked trout and cream cheese croissant - it was fresh, but the trout was minimal and not evenly distributed. We didn't taste the trout until we were almost done with the croissant. There is only outdoor seating so if it's raining, you're out of luck.
author: Josh L.

description:
The main reason I come to Dogpatch is for Neighbor Bakehouse. I've tried just about every pastry they have and the mushroom tart is my favorite. Flaky, buttery... mmmm. There's almost always a line in the mornings because everyone in the area knows that Neighbor Bakehouse is the best place to get a simple perfect breakfast. Think coffee & pastries. 

Neighbor Bakehouse beats B. Patisserie. Come here with someone so you can share multiple pastries.

Venue is small but there are outdoor benches if you want to eat there on a warmer day. 

Pro tip: Bring them home to heat up!
author: Ingrid C.

description:
Love, love, love this place. They're super nice and the pistachio raspberry croissant is my favorite pastry in SF-Tartine morning bun and arsicault chocolate almond croissant close after. 

Kimchi toast and passion fruit bun were also delicious.
author: Casey P.

description: Top notch San Francisco bakery. We've been there 3 times now and each time there's been different and unique goodies. I don't eat baked goods often but if I do, then they better be really good. This place doesn't disappoint and every time we leave, we can't believe how good their items are.
author: Rachel M.

description: This was my first time here and I found it by accident. However I'm glad I did because I can't stop thinking about the buttered croissant!! I also got a chocolate Chunk cookie and it was so good! I loved it and I will be returning.
author: Cadence E.

description: Everything that is created at this bakery is delectable. We ordered a couple of savory buns and a couple of sweet pastries. There were NO disappointments. Enough said!
author: Ada C.

description:
One of best in city!! 
Bostock is my favorite. The quality is amazing and I think it is worth the drive to the hood.
Savory croque Madame is amazing in morning when it is warm. 
All their bread is top quality!!
author: Alison W.

description: The best bakery in SF!  We like everything there.  The Croissants are perfect.  The twice-baked are my favorite
author: Angela H.

description: Tasty pastries and cookies, with coffee to go with it.  Great spot to hit up after a meal in the area.
author: Steve L.

description:
TLDR:
- Yes to pistachio croissants and mushroom tarts.
- Excellent flaky texture and soft crumb overall.
- Solid spot for coffee. They hire good baristas.
author: Christopher L.

description: What a bakery!  It beats the Tartine bakery hands down!  The sourdough bread looked so delicious that I pointed to it and it was put in a bag for me and it was only 6$!!!  What bread, this delicious, this leavened costs just 6 bucks?  Highly recommend visiting this place, one of the better bakeries in the area with some of the better pricing in the area
author: Chitra J.

description: This review is long overdue. I've been visiting Neighbor since they opened and have had only the best experience. Greg and his wife always have a smile on their faces and take time to chat with their customers. The staff is always patient and friendly. The pastries, breads, and coffee drinks are all exceptional. I'm especially a fan of their newest addition to the menu, the pizzette!
author: Amir A.

description: Delicious unique selections. Must go. Parking not clear keep that in mind. Wide range of goodies. Have to go a few times and try a few items to fully appreciate. Enjoy.
author: Chris X.

description: One of my favorite bakeries right now.  I've tried a lot of their delicious baked goods and loved them all!  Super nice people working there which makes me like this place even more.  One of my favorites is the almond bostock.... just make sure you wipe the powdered sugar off your face when you're done!
author: Tom T.

description: Yummmmm. Loved finding this new (to me) bakery. I got a croissant and was soooo flaky, light, and tasty!! Definitely get this! I also got the garlic pull apart. Sweet and delicious. Everything looked so good and can't wait to come back and try everything else! Staff was super friendly and everything was quick. Thanks!!
author: Emily F.

description: I like this place a lot however I noticed they over bake some of their sourdough. We purchased a loaf that looked good but the crust was very bitter and not edible. They also enjoy unusual pastries so if your looking straight cinnamon roll or danish you won't find it here.
author: Roby R.

description: Sooooooo gooooooood and consistent every time. Its gotten more crowded now but the wait is worth it! I love their orange fancier, pistacio, passion fruit
author: Ellie D.

description:
This is the best bakery I have ever been to!

Everything I have tried here has been awesome, but so far my favorites have been the ham and cheese morning bun and the pistachio blackberry twice baked croissant. With both of these options, the fillings are delicious and spread nicely throughout the middles, and the dough is perfectly flaky and flavorful.

It's better to get here in the earlier part of the morning because they start to sell out of certain options early and by noon you may only have a fraction of the menu left from which to choose.
author: Elizabeth B.

description:
Neighbor Bakehouse is the best bakery I have ever been to.

Christopher, Indy and Jamil are the face of their shop checking out customers. They are very good hearted souls who are another reason for me to frequent this bakery apart from its perfectly baked goodies. The conversations with them are very positive and engaging. I am sure the owners of this place are good people and take care of their employees well. Happy Employees = Good Owners.  Great Product + Happy Employees = Happy Customers.
author: Piyush H.

description:
The best croissants and pain au chocolat in SF : BAR NONE !
Only "complaint": they're only open on the weekends !
author: Allen T.

description:
"Back again already?""

Yup, I was here two mornings in a row for their passion fruit bun.  I love the sauerkraut smoked cheddar bun and ginger pull apart bread too.  Neighbor Bakehouse takes familiar pastries, adds an interesting flavor to it, and executes it to perfection.  All of the employees are friendly and have a sense of humor, too.  A neighborhood bakery can't get better than this!
author: Cathy S.

description:
Great crispy on the outside, buttery and soft in the inside butter and chocolate croissants. I'll grab a box of pastries and a cup of cappuccino. They're a huge hit with my clients who love them. 
Hazelnut candied orange financiers, ginger pulls, and morning buns are a few of our faves.
Convenient location right off the T line.
author: Stephanie Y.

description: I cannot begin to tell you how spectacular this place is! I live in Potrero so for me it's a quick 10 minute walk (which allows me to justify eating the delicious baked goods) to the bakehouse. I'm in most Friday mornings and there's a barista who remembers my coffee order EVERY time I go in and is incredibly friendly. Gotta get his name and will update because he's half the reason why I love this place so much. The morning bun, and veggie or mushroom tarts are my go-tos. I can't do sweet for breakfast or I have a sugar crash but I have tried the cinnamon bostock, and their cookies are also next level. I highly suggest this to anyone who hasn't been. Note that they have outdoor seating but no indoor seating so if the weather is inclement you will have to take your goods to go. Oh the coffee is also pretty amazing which is a must here in the city.
author: Rachelle T.

description: I love the random pastries - sweet and savory. There are so many options! Yes it is pricey, but I think it's worth it, in my opinion. Many of their items do run out by the early afternoon, so come early! All croissants are delicious. The croque madame was great.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
Finally tried this place.
The parking was horrible. 

i got three items: their ham & cheese morning bun, their ginger pull-apart, and their pistachio blackberry twice-baked. i didn't really care for the morning bun. it was too "seedy" for my taste. the poppy, sesame seeds were a bit too much and it did not have enough ham & cheese taste. i ordered the pistachio blackberry because they told me that it was the most popular one. i thought it was good but nothing special.

the best thing was the ginger pull-apart. it was flaky, sweet, and not too gingery. it had a caramelized outer layer and a flaky inside. of course, it wasn't as flaky and caramelized as a kouign amann from b. patisserie but i thought it was similar for comparison.
author: Heejin L.

description: Tragically hip bakery with all the usual trimmings: battery acid coffee, unappetizing combinations and high prices.  Probably just what you're after if you're that kind of hipster.
author: Adrian J.

description: Flaky and crispy croissants, check!  Delicious smelling and tasting bread, check!  Neighbor Bakehouse is a go-to destination when ever you're in The Dogpatch.  Tucked away on 3rd st., this gem makes my mouth water every time I step foot in here.  There can be a line at times, but definitely nothing as high volume as Tartine.  Frankly, the pastries here are way better than Tartine anyway.  I usually get this pastry that has pistachios and blueberries in it.  The top is dusted with powdered sugar and it's really outstanding.  Staff is friendly and the vibes are right.  Highly recommended!
author: Josh S.

description:
I stop by Neighbor on a semi-regular basis and cannot praise this place enough!  Pastries are phenomenal - the flakiness of their croissant dough is top notch to say the least.  They have some great stables to always choose from (can't say no to the ginger pull apart), but they're always trying new things as well.  Kimchi on brioche toast?  Might sound weird to many but it was actually amazing!  Their more classic items are delicious as well including their bread loaves.  Between their sourdough sandwich loaf and rustic sourdough round I don't think anyone could deny that the carbs you'll ingest from this place are WELL worth your while.  

There's tons of suggestions riddled in these reviews, but here are a few of my top picks:

Ginger pull apart
Passion fruit dough bun
Croque Madame (SO FILLING)
Coffee cake (I never like this anywhere)
Any of the new/seasonal items

Be sure to also grab some coffee if you drop by.  The baristas are great, with Califia almond milk available as well, and if you're a cold brew type they have a great nitro on tap as well.
author: Kellyn W.

description: Forget Tartine and their long lines, trek over to Dogpatch for an even more delightful experience. I had actually never been to the area prior to coming to an event at Pier 70. The neighborhood is industrial, but charming and there are numerous gems hidden here. The line was long, but I was through the line with a latte in hand within 10 minutes. I feel like some bakeries make their lines long on purpose, but this place is straight to the business of serving you amazing baked goods. I got the pistachio blackberry croissant at the recommendation of the bakers and boy was I not disappointed. This was by far one of the best croissants I have ever had. Super flaky, just the right amount of sweetness, and a perfect balance of ingredients. My friend got the ham and cheese morning bun, and the ham inside was top notch. I literally live across the street from Tartine, but I'd venture to say I'll be visiting this place more often now.
author: Carly H.

description:
Absolutely amazing pastries -- we tried the saurkraut/cheddar croissant, the chocolate claw, the ginger pull-apart, and the chocolate almond bostock. Hard to pick a favorite, but the chocolate claw will be hard to beat.

Will be back! Line was short at 10 am on a Saturday morning (surprisingly).
author: K. D.

description: Awesome - friendly delicious baked goods. The cookie was DELICIOUS!
author: Andrew K.

description:
This place has become our weekly Saturday late-morning ritual. Their savory goods are the best I've ever had, and their sweets are to die for. Every week they have something slightly different, and it's always been amazing.  

The owners and staff are also super friendly! Puts a smile on my face every time I see them :).
author: Richard S.

description: If the espresso coffee they offer can be better, that would be perfect. It was lack of coffee aroma and no latte art when I tried last time. No doubt that their pastries and croissants are really good!
author: Jessie L.

description: This is a great little bakery if you looking for tasty treats! My wife and I stopped in here on a Saturday morning to grab a coffee and a pastry. She got the guava pastelito. I got the ham and cheese morning bun. They both were delicious! I would have preferred mine warm but it was still good. The bun was flaky and the flavors were very good. The coffee was also very good. I highly recommend that if you are in the area that you try Neighbor Bakehouse!
author: Ian G.

description:
Do yourself a favor -- on any Weekend morning, find your way to this magical purveyor of scrumptiously baked goods, wait in line, and start your day with an indulgently sweet and/or savory treat. 

Their staff are a delight. Pastries are quite well portioned. 1-2 per person is perfect. High marks go to the:
- blueberry pistachio croissant -- a revelation, frankly
- ginger pullapart -- made perfectly to tear&share
- mushroom tart -- if you like pastry, mushroom, cheese, then this is your jam

We'll be back tomorrow.
author: Romeo L.

description: The best pastries, coffee, and service around. A must stop (three times so far this week) when we come up to the city. You can't go wrong with anything and if you're unsure just ask.....the nicest people around will point you in the right direction!
author: Camille A.

description:
I'm all for businesses that are walking distance from my place.  And if it's a bakery, even better!!  

Neighbor Bakehouse is just that.  The neighborhood bakery with very yummy baked goods.  I love that it's low key and has really addictive Ginger Pull Aparts and Croissants!!
author: Janel C.

description: Saw the 5-star/440 reviews for this bakery and thought I better try it out. The place was super cute and had a nice outdoor eating area. I came 10 minutes before closing and there was still lots of selection. I decided on the pistachio and blackberry croissant because of other Yelp recommendations and I was not disappointed. If was sooo flaky and delicious. The whole bakery atmosphere was really nice and I now understand the 5 stars. Highly recommend!!
author: Melissa W.

description:
I love this cute little pastry/coffee place.  I've only been here twice and they were both good, although the second time much more memorable.

I like their chai latte (which I got both times), but have to say the star of the show is really the pastries.  They make it fresh -- you can actually see them making it.  The first time I came right as they were closing, so my pastry choices were super limited.  I ended up getting a wheat croissant, which was probably as good as a wheat croissant could be.  

The second time was MUCH better.  I took my boyfriend's sister and her boyfriend to this place.  It was a rainy day and they let us chill inside.  We had brunch plans also, but their pastry was so good, we split a vegetarian pastry (croque madam looking thing?).  Everything else looked really good, but we had to hold ourselves back.

The people there were also super nice.   They chatted with us, and gave us utensils to split the pastries with.
author: Carrie L.

description: Wow what a delicious find in the DogPatch this rainy Sunday morning.  I wish I had one of everything.  Super friendly and fast service.  Wonderful coffee and now my go to place when I am in the neighborhood!
author: Felicia T.

description:
Neighbor Bakehouse is now my favorite bakery in the city. I've been a fan of Neighbor for a long time and used to go to Cafe Sophie just for their goods. It's great they now have their own retail space.

They do interesting takes on classics, such as the pistachio croissant (in lieu of almond), the almond frangipane bostok, and so on. They're also wonderfully creative coming up with things that make you think and also make you smile. For example, the Everything Bagel Croissant or Cheese and Spicy Kraut. You can't go wrong in getting pastries from Neighbor Bakehouse. Just close your eyes and point!

They have outdoor seating only, so if it's a cold day, just get it to go or make sure you're dressed appropriately. They usually have a small line, but it always goes fast and I've never had to wait more than 5-10 minutes.
author: Victoria J.

description:
The best fresh quality so far, you won't regret it.

They have both savory and sweets.

Don't miss the chocolate croissant it's simply yummy  you can't go wrong with it!
author: Lilian S.

description:
Neighbor bakehouse is the best bakery in San Francisco and Greg the owner was voted best baker! 
The pastries he comes up with are absolutely delicious. This is a must if you are visiting sf. 
The staff is friendly and the food is to die for. Everything is good, I especially love the passionfruit buns. Also his holiday pies are the best I have ever tried!!
author: Anya M.

description: The line is long but quick and they sell out some items. The specialize in savory pastries and really are the best.
author: Stephanie R.

description:
Great place! We got the pistachio one, almond, ham and cheese, mushroom, ginger pull apart. Everything tasted good, I don't think you will go wrong with any choice.

No seating inside though!
author: Linda X.

description:
Delicious croissant-based pastries!!! The ginger pull-apart was terrific, and I'll be back for the Croque Madame (sp). Outdoor only seating, takes Apple pay, short walk from UCSF Mission Bay.
Love the short list of espressos and teas. The friendly staff were happy to explain the pastry menu and show us our choices. 
Fantastic!!
author: Char S.

description: Neighbor Bakehouse is a small store with outdoor seating and delicious savory and sweet pastries. When I arrived there were 7 options available. Even though it was a difficult choice I chose the savory ham and cheese morning bun. I really enjoyed the flakiness and the poppy seeds add a nice nutty flavor. Although it a little pricey, I am definitely coming back to try everything.
author: Andrew W.

description: This is what a bakery should be. Open early and only for a few hours selling their freshest baked goods. You walk in order your pastry and walk out; none of this fancy-stuffy-standing-in-line-San Francisco bullshit. I've tried almost everything and it's always been solid. My favorite is their everything croissant which is similar to an everything bagel. It's flaky with cream cheese and chives in the center. Carb heaven.
author: Cindy A.

description: If you like morning pastries, you won't find a better place. Compares favorably against Tartine and similar high end SF favorites.
author: pedram a.

description:
This is one of the best bakery's I've ever been to. Maybe the best. 

On par with the best from other cities, and I liked it better than Tartine, which is also amazing.

Get the ginger pull apart and the ham and cheese morning bun which are just truly special. Chocolate croissant and mushroom tart were also great.
author: Falqsc O.

description: I think I'm solo in the one star, but the customer service just has never won me over...I always feel hated when ordering pastries, *sigh*, which are DELISH. But I'd rather trek over to Farley's for a scone. Much more neighborly (ha!) and also their dirtbombs?? Cinnamon love.
author: Elle N M.

description:
This place - oh.my.gawwwwd. 

Staff is so friendly. The pastries are amazing. This place is everything Tartine is not. YAY!! I bought a ginger pull apart and a ham/cheese morning bun - and only intended to eat one on their picnic bench. But the first one was so good - there was no stopping me. I took a breath and briefly considered getting back in line to get some more to go. Then I slapped myself on the side of the head and moved on. 

Get there early! I had made two or three previous trips and was turned away because they had already sold out.
author: Robin P.

description: Very small place in the Dogpatch. Only two small tables outside and a bench to enjoy your pastries.  But these pastries are so delicious. Perfectly baked with a balance of crunchy on the outside and buttery flaky layers.  So far I have tried the croissant, ginger pull apart, chocolate claw, mushroom tart and veggie tart (which was kale and butternut squash at the moment).  It doesn't matter if you are craving sweet or savory because they were all delicious.  Towards lunchtime, they start running out of choices so come early if you want the full effect. Next time I will try the croque madame and guava cheese pastelito. Yum.
author: Maria G.

description: Amazing baked goods.  Meant to take a pic of the special croissant they had with ham, cheese and a soft boiled egg inside....but I was so excited....I accidentally ate it first. Oops! Crazy good. The pistachio blackberry is also excellent and excited to try the bostock.  Service has always been super friendly. Love ending my run here and taking muni back w a few items. That said, I have been known to run home...bagged ginger pull apart in hand. It held up well!
author: Debbie L.

description: The pistachio blackberry croissant is delicious! Looking forward to trying the almond with custard croissant.
author: Karla C.

description: Does it get any better than this place? Yum! Great coffee drinks too. I'll be back!
author: bennett h.

description: Holy butter croissant! This place is amazing...get everything!! Their savory pastries are out of this world. I came here on a Saturday morning and the line was about 15 people strong. It went by super fast. The ladies up front were full of cheer, and after having had about 3 pastries, I nearly wept, and understood what was behind everyone's smile. I had bought 4 pastries intending on saving most of it for my girlfriend, but I couldn't resist eating all of it, and only saving her half a ham and cheese croissant, which I still found it very difficult to do. There are plenty of big tables out front and the pastries themselves were not very expensive. I am not one bit surprised at a solid 5 star rating. Do it.
author: Elton F.

description: The ginger pull apart is my go to, partially because I can't eat anything with powdered sugar without wearing it. I stopped in today and they had Croque Madame fresh from the oven. These have always been hit or miss for me. When they're bad, they taste like shoe leather on soggy bread with a waxy lid of old cheese. So I reluctantly nodded when the woman behind the counter suggested it. Friends, this was quiet something. The bread was chewy but still light, and it gave way easily under my fork. The ham and cheese were tasty, the béchamel well seasoned (not an easy feat), and then, to my utter delight, halfway through, I found an egg under the toppings. Warm yellow yolk to mop up with the remaining bread, ham, and cheese. Well done, Neighbor Bakehouse.
author: Ryan C.

description: Finally a bakehouse sweetshop that has good customer service! Staff is super sweet n friendly. Everything i had there which was just about 1 of everything was good! Ample parking. Only outdoor seating so come on a warm sunny day.
author: Melissa K.

description:
Yay! I finally made it here early enough! Totally worth getting up early and trekking out here. All the baked goods here are DELICIOUS!! So flaky and flavorful. 

My favorites are the mushroom tart, pistachio double baked croissant thing and the guava cheese. 

Even though dogpatch is kind of out of the way, there is never really a line and easy to find parking on the weekends!!
author: Clarice C.

description:
The Ginger Pull Apart was the best pastry I've had in recent memory! Crunchy, flaky pastry on top with a soft, buttery center and a bottom layer of crunchy, caramelized sugar. 

I like a place where I walk in and just looking at each pastry makes my jaw drop. Also love the outdoor seating and small glass of sparkling water with my espresso.
author: Miriam O.

description: Get the pistachio blackberry croissant, double points of you get it right off the oven. Things do sell out so get there early!
author: Betty C.

description: Good pastries with a wide variety of ingredients (sweet, savory, etc.), flaky and buttery croissants.  I recommend it.
author: Peter L.

description: This was my first time at the Neighborhood Bakehouse and considering it was a hole in the wall, I honestly did not expect much. However they had bakers on site so I knew whatever I ordered was going to be made fresh,,,and it was! I ordered the pistachio blackberry croissant and a macchiato. The croissant was crispy on the outside with a lot of powdered sugar and moist inside with blackberries. So yum. The macchiato was warm and strong and a great way to finish my little meal. I sat outside and noticed many people were regulars. I will definitely be coming back. Also, awesome customer service. They cashier was very sweet and gave me recommendations when I walked in.
author: Shan M.

description: Came here for the first time Sunday morning around 8, and was able to park right in front, and no line. Their mushroom tarts, butter croissants and ham & cheese morning buns were very good. Friendly staff and cute store. Will come back again!
author: Ellen H.

description: we tried the passion fruit thing and the rasberry thing they were both delicious and cripsy, would come back soon
author: Momo P.

description: The croissants were soooo good.  It was my luck that the conference I was attending was merely a couple blocks away from this bakery.  I can't wait to come back and spend more time in this neighborhood.
author: Nina K.

description: Best croissants I've had. If you're looking for something more filling get the twice baked pistachio-very rich.
author: Becca D.

description:
The pastries are great, but I will probably not be back.

I placed a pre-order several days in advance intending to provide brunch for colleagues at a meeting. Picked up the order the morning of the meeting and went back to my workplace near Pac Heights. I then opened the box to find 2 items missing from the order, despite showing them the paid invoice with a list of ordered items at the pick up counter. 

When I called Neighbor to inquire about the order error, I was told by the owner that I could either get a refund on the items that had been left out or come back to pick them up. While I did get an apology, the options given to me were not super helpful when you are on the other side of the city, the meeting is about to begin, and you are two short of feeding your colleagues.

Obviously, I wouldn't have cared if the order was for a bunch of friends in a casual setting, but it is a little awkward when you are trying to treat colleagues at work and it looks like you forgot some people. I get that mistakes happen and this isn't some terrible tragedy, but it would have been nice to get a little more than just a choice between have your money back or come get it yourself. I feel like if you screw up an order that is placed and paid in advance and are even shown a list of ordered items at pick up, it would be nice to offer a small discount on the order or maybe offer a discount for a future group order. I came away with the impression that they were "sorry" but not sorry enough to do much about it. 

Yes, the pastries are probably some of the best in SF, but this experience definitely left a bad aftertaste.
author: X Y.

description:
Now let me preface that I am biased, as I am a HUGE breakfast person and love me a good cafe/bakery....  I came here on a Saturday morning to grab a quick bite. Soooo amazing!!  There was a short line when I arrived, and the inside of the shop is very minimal. The only seating is outside, which luckily it was a gorgeous day. The workers were super friendly, as were the other patrons. 
I had the everything morning bun (perfect flakiness on the outside and softness on the inside, with all the seeds of an everything bagel to make it the perfect savory treat) and the pistachio blackberry croissant (I don't even know where to start, the combination of flavor a was heavenly and again it was cooked to perfection capturing all the great qualities of a good croissant).  

The hours here are a bit odd, so check before you go, but it is definitely worth checking out.
author: Sarah F.

description: Can you drool enough over neighbors bakery? Best bakery.. ever?? Depends on what you like. Of all the bakeries in SF, neighbors shines with their unique pastries like ginger pullapart bread for that nice tang to balance the sweetness, or their pistachio blackberry croissant. I've come here multiple times (or more like I've made detours to come here multiple times) as well as to my favorite ice cream shop nearby. Other delicious expertly created pastries I can recall are their mushroom and cheese pastry or passion fruit doughp nut. Try them all. You will not be disappointed.
author: joda l.

description: Stumpled on this magical bakery on Sunday and loved all three types of pastries I bought. Really hoped that I had ordered doubles or triples. love love the financiers
author: Lisa L.

description:
Legitimately some of the best pastries I've ever had.  So flaky, so crisp, and yet not too sweet at the same time.  Might be my favorite bakery in the city now!

Also, the customer service deserves some attention.  The people behind the counter are super enthusiastic without sounding like they're trying to upsell you on everything and were really eager to give me recommendations. You can tell that they have an immense amount of pride for this bakery, and deservedly so.
author: Norman S.

description: This place is amazing. Have never had anything here that I didn't love. Seriously. The staff is so friendly as well! Good people and good food!
author: Sal F.

description: Amazing place! I love the feel of this bakery. They offer some delicious pastries. Everything here is buttery. I ordered savory buns and sweet pastries and the taste was so good and fresh. There is no seating inside. The staff was very friendly and the service was good. There were no disappointments. Definitely will be back!
author: Benito C.

description: I tried this place for the first time and fell in love with it! I'm surprised that the line isn't ridiculously long like some of the other popular ones in SF. Another thing that's different is the service. Very friendly and fast unlike some of the other ones I experienced. We bought the passionfruit dough bun, passionfruit macaroon, butter croissant & pistachio. All were great and we didn't even get a chance to take a picture before inhaling all the pastries. Next time...
author: NT T.

description: Went for the first time today and thought I immediately need to write a review because everything I had was so delicious!! I ordered the chocolate pudding dough bun, everything crossiant, ham & cheese morning bun, and ginger pull apart (sorry if I got the names wrong) but that is besides the point bc I highly recommend this place! My fav was the ginger pull apart, I don't think I've ever been so in love with a pastry like this one! Believe the 5 star hype it's no joke :)
author: Jen A.

description: Their Hazelnut Brown Butter Cake/Financier is hands-down the best thing I've ever eaten that comes out of an oven.  I get these from Sightglass, which buys these wholesale from Neighbor Bakehouse.  These things sell out pretty fast at SG so (on the weekends) I literally will get to SG as soon as the doors open so I can buy half a dozen at a time (which I eat for breakfast each Saturday and Sunday).  Words can't describe how good these treats are if you're a baked goods fan like me.  If you have not tried these, go and get some.  I will say "you're welcome" now.
author: Joey S.

description: This place is great!!! Everything is super delicious, the pistachio, blackberry croissant, while not really a croissant,  is an extraordinary pastry treat. Espresso drinks are spot on. Staff all super sweet too.
author: Karen W.

description:
Easily one of my favorite bakeries! All the savory tarts are amazing I can't even pick a favorite. You should just try all three and decide for yourself! The ingredients and flavors are all so delicate and delicious, you will not e disappointed. For sweet pastries, my favorite would be the ginger pullapart (real gingery for you ginger lovers!!) and the blackberry pistachio croissant. BEST. CROISSANT. EVER. There are a ton of good bakeries around the city but Neighbor Bakehouse is truly a gem. They also serve de la paz coffee so even more incentive to check em out! 

If for whatever reason you're unable to make it out to the dogpatch before noon, you can always try to score a pastry at a local coffee shop. They have a listing of where you can find their pastries so now you have no excuses!
author: Maryann S.

description:
We came here on Friday afternoon and was able to purchase (7) plain croissants, (1) almond croissant and a loaf of "ciabatta bread made with sourdough base, whatever .
Croissants: each almost the size of my hand, did not compel my eyes to widen in a state of glee. Though I thought the "size" was kind of smaller according to my perception, the taste was soft and quite dense, and definitely lots of butter was involved.  I toasted one and the butter was just oozing--the top part passed the flakiness test. Overall grade of a B+
Almond croissant: Looked delectable, smelled delectable and assumed it'd be delectable. Turns out to be a real let-down. The almond paste was skimpy, in fact, there was a thin spread of it. Bit into it, resulted into an experience of texture that was hollow and flat. No substance. This piece is acceptable to be picked up from an Andronico's baked good section, but from a highly rated bakery--something's not right then. Overall grade: C
Ciabatta bread: Excellent. Dense, soft, chewy an warm.  Again, very dense. Loved it. Overall grade: A
Service: Fast, efficient and friendly. Abundance was available, appears to be little fear of baked goods running low, god forbid, "nothing left."  Overall grade: A
author: Nicole M.

description: I've tried many of the baked goods over the course of the last year but today I got the kimchee toast. WOW enough to make me want to write a review. It's spicy, buttery, creamy and crunchy at the same time. I really want another one as I'm chewing the last bite of my current toast. I know it sounds strange but it is fantastic.
author: Cindy J.

description:
Neighbor Bakehouse is seriously my favorite croissant place right now! 

I crave the Everything Croissant ($3.50)! It's seeded on the outside and inside has a small amount of onion cream cheese. Devine and genius. I don't know if it's because I love it so much, or because it's on the smaller size, but this croissant is eaten in no time! 

For a sweet tooth, try the Ginger Pull-apart ($3.50). It is made up of croissant scraps and is sweet is caramelized and awesome.
author: Rachelle T.

description:
I work dangerously close to this place. It s not good for my wallet or my waistline how close this place is to my office. 

The laminated dough pastries/croissant type things are freaking delicious. After consuming one in literally thirty seconds it took a whole lot of self control to not walk back to the shop and purchase the rest of the goods.  Buttery, flaky and they have just the right amount of crunch. 

I will be back to try the rest of the pastries and to try to get my hands on a loaf of bread. They do have fancy coffee, but  I haven't tried it yet. 


Parking during the week might be a tad difficult, so I'd recommend transit but on weekends you can find parking on side streets easily.
author: Claire C.

description:
This is what a croissant is supposed to taste like. Flaky flaky fresh out of the oven. I just want to crawl into this croissant and drink coffee while I take bites out of the croissant walls and say 'croissant' over and over in my best French accent. Cwasant, Quoi Sant, Kwasannt. Don't judge me, I'm in my croissant, there is no judgement in the warm chewy confines of the croissant.

Blackberry Pistachio Croissant! Mushroom tart! Financiers! All so good. 

I also really like this story: http://www.sfgate.com/restaurants/article/Neighbor-Bakehouse-How-good-croissants-came-to-6040784.php

These things they make aren't just delicious they're pretty! Bon Appetit!
author: Marissa S.

description: Dunno why SF is getting all the amazing bakeshops lately. Tried out some that the brother bought and I devoured most of it the same night. Most bakeshops don't do savory that well, but Neighbor's is the exception. My favorite thing I tried was this square pastry that tasted like a really caramelized croissant. It doesn't beat kouign amann but man it was good. I look forward to visiting this place in person.
author: Michael H.

description: My friends have been raving about Neighbor Bakehouse so I decided to give it a try! I got there around 9am on Saturday and there was a line, but it moved fast -- I got my food in about 10 minutes. I got the ginger pull-apart, the everything croissant, pistachio blackberry croissant, and a cafe au lait. My favorite was the everything croissant! It was so savory and delicious, I think I could eat it every day. The ginger pull-apart was good too, but I wish there was more of a ginger taste? Haven't tried the pistachio yet because it'll be my breakfast for tomorrow. :) Would gladly go back! Glad to see a very good bakery with reasonable lines and wait time.
author: Mai H.

description:
This place is pastry HEAVEN.

We tried pretty much everything they had to offer and all their pastries were exceptional. My absolute favorites were the everything croissant and the ginger pull apart. 

Thank goodness these guys aren't actually in my neighborhood and I can only make it here on weekends. Otherwise I'm pretty sure I'd be here 24/7 and turn into one giant pastry!

I've got to hand it to them though, they are baking geniuses!
author: Kristen C.

description:
finding parking is difficult at Neighbor Bakehouse so i parked in front,  literally dashed in and out. 

only about 6 pastries and La Paz coffee available.

eats: butter croissant(3)
-buttery, flakey yes, almost burnt coloring ala Holmes (must be the new NEW)
-   tart(3.5)
gobbed it down as i was driving, delicious chocolate something.
4.5 stars

crumbs:
-pastries almost unmatched, on par with Holmes, B Patisserie
will update when/if i find my illegible notes.
-a few tables in front of shop
-wish there was more offerings, but then they sell fast, i guess.
author: Victor G.

description: Amazing baked goods!  I had been running by here in the mornings, and there is always a line of people out front so I decided to check it out today.  Although I wanted to get one of everything, I narrowed it down to the Everything Croissant, the Kimchi Bun, and the Chocolate Claw. All three were sooooooo good!  I don't think I can pick a favorite since they were all quite different but equally tasty. I definitely want to go back to taste the other items.
author: Jennifer E.

description: This place is the bomb! We got lucky that it was a rainy day as the lines weren't as long and items not sold out. Had a couple savory (mushroom tart, veggie tartine) and couple sweet (almond chocolate, ginger pull apart) baked goodies, all to die for!! Yumm!
author: Dhivya P.

description: ***BOOM*** This bakery is legit! They do not disappoint. Please do allot time to wait in line and find a spot outside at the picnic tables.
author: Kelly C.

description: Cute little pastry shop. Outdoor seating only.  No decaf lattes but they have decaf drip or au laits. Pastries are fresh,  flaky,  yummy,  delish.
author: Denise L.

description:
The BOMB of bakeries! everything fresh and delicious! 
All sorts of different croissants and Danishes.

Don't get over this way to often and its good as I'd gain a lot of weight!
author: Frank H.

description: I came here for the ginger pull apart pastry but was unimpressed. The croissants, however,  were deliciously fluffy and yummy. For the croissants, I would come again. I'll bump up the ratings after I try a few more pastry items at the place.
author: W A.

description:
I will have dreams about this place when I'm back in DC. 

I walked by this place thinking that it would be closed (it was after their normal hours) but their door was open, so I took a chance and went in. The three people working the store were super friendly, and offered me cold brew. I went straight for the pastries-there weren't a ton left since it was the end of the day, but I chose the pistachio blackberry tart. I brought it out to the waterfront to eat with my tamale from earlier, and enjoyed a few minutes of heaven on earth. I literally scraped the bottom of my bag for crumbs. 
 
I will have to return when I'm back in SF in December to try the ginger pull apart. Not sure if I can hold out for that long.
author: Leighliana J.

description:
Neighbor Bakehouse adds so much joy to my life. Whether it's just walking by the storefront and seeing relaxed, happy people enjoying a flaky croissant in the sun or actually stopping inside as a nice break from work to grab a handful of pastries to share with the office, it's always a pleasant occasion.

I saw a biker stuffing about 30 pastries into his messenger bag once and it made my day. Buying pastries at Neighbor is delightful.

The staff is so friendly and Greg, the baker, once gave my coworker a free pastry when he inquired about the unlabeled kouign amann-ish pastry which I'm sure has now evolved into the ginger pull-apart after some iterations.

As a pistachio and blackberry lover, naturally I love the pistachio blackberry croissant. The chocolate claw and bostock are lovely too. My favorite thing to do is buy 3-5 pastries and share them all. Rarely is tasting a little bit of everything not the best option.

At Neighbor you don't feel that pretentious air as you might at Tartine, nor do you have to wait in absurdly long lines. I'm sure this will change one day as Dogpatch gains more and more businesses and residents, but for now it's the greatest thing.
author: Sydney M.

description:
tl:dr This place rules. Go there now. 

I come here fairly often in the mornings. 

Their pastries are all top quality but I especially recommend the Manchego & Mushroom Tart and the Ginger pull apart(it pairs very well with coffee). 

Staff is very attentive and friendly.
author: Michael H.

description:
place is like Mr Holmes.  but I think the pastries would taste even better heated. ginger pull apart, nice sugar and subtle ginger, caramelized brown sugar on the bottom.  the savory pastries great
sauerkraut smoked cheddar peppadew tart, light, mild sauerkraut
smoked ham and gruyere morning bun, swirled within, covered with sunflower and poppy seeds
mushroom green onion manchego tart
butter croissant -- light and flaky with a well ­developed honeycomb crumb
pistachio blackberry twice baked croissant -- nod to almond croissant, more powdered sugar
author: Rob C.

description: The cats out of the bag, this place is my favorite bakery now.  They do really interesting pastries, some combinations I have never even seen until now - very inventive.  Been here twice, between both visits very different items on display.  Just wish they were open a little bit later to get my fix after work.
author: Kevin H.

description: Yeah I have to jump on board and give 5 stars - this place is great. I've now had about have the menu and they were all home runs. Plus, I tend to use the classic croissant as sort of a litmus test for bakeries and Neighbor's is pretty spot on. Good job y'all.
author: William A.

description:
Love at first bite and it goes on from there. Becoming a regular stop now. 

Entire staff is exceptional-as high quality as their products.
author: Mark M.

description:
Best pastries in (probably) the world.  

I used to buy them at Front Coffee and it was an indicator to how my day was going to go if they were sold out by the time I got there.  Now they have their OWN place?  Prayers answered.

That flaky crust... the goat cheese... poppy seeds and ham and caramelized onions?  Oh I just love ya.
author: Rachelle P.

description:
Best bakery in San Francisco. Their pastries are delicious and everyone welcomes you with a smile.

My favorite item is the ginger pull apart. It's like a sticky monkey bread muffin but with croissant instead of bread. The crunchy caramelized bits are the best. 

The second favorite is croque madame. The soft boiled egg on top is always perfect. It's definitely something that needs to be eaten with a knife and fork, though. 

They also make one of the best almond lattes I've ever had. I'm so happy their pasties are now at Red Door cafe in the SOMA.
author: Irene W.

description:
Amazing. Interesting pastries. I had the Sauerkraut and Smoked Cheddar pastry. It was not-quite-a-croissant but not like a danish either.  Wished I'd taken a photo before snarfing it down.  The ingredients sound crazy for a pastry, but don't knock it until  you try it.

My girls predictably got the Chocolate Claw.  In their words, BEST. THING. EVER.

Great neighborhood spot and easy stopover on way to work downtown.
author: Susie M.

description: Bakeries are a weakness of mine and Neighbor Bakehouse makes me weak at the knees.  I got the bostock, chocolate claw and sauerkraut pastry.  I can't decide which one was my favorite but you can bet that I'm going to be back here time and time again.  Only downfall is trying to find parking around here especially in the morning during the work week.
author: Blake B.

description: I've been hearing never ending rave reviews about this place.  The first time I wanted to go here, it turned out they were closed.  The second time was on a weekend morning, and they had a sign on the door that they were closed.  The third time my bf was able to pic up some snacks while I was home sick.  We got a hazelnut pastry, the croissant, and mushroom tart.  My favorite out of them was probably the mushroom tart.  Although everything was great I still think that tartine is the best bakery in the city.  At some point I want to go back and try the breads, which I also hear are great.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
As part of my exercise routine, I ride by bike early in the mornings around downtown SF,  in particular Mission Bay and Dogpatch. After finding Neighbor Bakehouse on Yelp, I knew I had to try it. 

I read other reviews on what to eat and decided to try their Pistachio Blackberry Croissant and Bostock with Almond Frangipani. The Blackberry croissant tasted really good, but I am a huge almond fan and when I took a bite of the Bostock, I couldn't stop - OMG it was sooo good. I had to stop so I could share the pastries with my family. 

I told my East Bay running friends about this place and they made a special trip out to the city. They were floored at how good it was! They ate their pastries and went for a run in Golden Gate Park. Eat well and then burn it off - works for me!
author: Allie L.

description: Granted, the croissant was the flakiest I've had since France, but $4 for a smoked trout croissant that contained only a teeny tiny bit of trout is outrageous.
author: Eva UnTiger S.

description:
Everything is solid (veggie, chocolate, butter, etc)...but the double baked blackberry and pistachio croissant is otherworldly.  But who am I kidding, you wouldn't like that croissant.  Just get all of the others.

I'll have trouble avoiding this place on the weekends.
author: Sanket K.

description:
This bakehouse simply can do no wrong. I've tried just about all of their baked items and been pleasantly surprised by each one! This is dangerous, as it's so conveniently located down the street from Dogpatch Boulders... 

Albertino M. recommended this spot to me awhile back and I could not be more grateful! They might be a little too pricey ($3.50-4.50 per item) to have all the time but I love them all the same. My favorites are definitely (well, besides all of them), the almond something (looks like a really light bear claw), the hazelnut brown butter one, and I just fell in love with the smoked cheese and sauerkraut one. 

I don't know what it is about these that makes them so incredible: they're light and flaky but still substantial, not too greasy but have great buttery taste, and the other ingredients they mix in add such delightful flavors to each one. I've tried the bread pudding with creme fraiche as well, also amazing. With croissants and pastries this good, they definitely sell out on occasion so don't wait too late in the morning! You've been warned, SF.
author: Trish A.

description: These pastries are pretty pricey but on the times when I feel like spending a little bit more money for breakfast I would definitely come to Neighbor Bakehouse and pick me up an EVERYTHING CROISSANT & GINGER PULL-APART. These two pastries will make any morning just 10x better.
author: Wyatt T.

description:
Dear T-bakery in the Mission with the long lines, 

It is not you. It is me. I'm so sorry (not really). We have to break up. I can't take your burnt croissants anymore. 

The croissants here are light, flaky and yet, buttery. NB has captured my stomach and doesn't even rob me of my wallet. I just wish that my dates with NB had parking. 

The people here are happy, the space is airy and sunny, and the sidewalks are clean. 

Don't worry T-bakery. I'm sure you'll be too busy with your weekend fans to miss me much. But if you do, just take comfort that I'm in a much better place.

Adieu,
GL
author: Gene L.

description: Loved everything we tried here, but particularly the mushroom and veggie tarts, and twice baked pistachio-blueberry croissant. There is always a line but it moves fast and everyone is friendly. This is now one of my go-to bakeries.
author: Claire D.

description: I'm a guy who loves to eat donuts and pastries anytime of the day. Well I read the reviews and decided to try this bakery out. I stopped in Wednesday morning, 7 AM, and ordered a ginger pull-apart...$3.75 +tax/tip. I would think by getting in early and getting first pick of the morning batch that this pastry would be especially warm and fresh, but I was sadly disappointed. It definitely wasn't fresh and to be honest, the flavor of this ginger pull-apart wasn't even close to anything deserving of a 2.5 star review.  It actually left me wishing I had gone to Krispy Kreeme instead.  Maybe I'll give it another try some other time, but for now I wouldn't recommend Neighbor Bakehouse to friends. #MissingPortos.  Sorry
author: Smash U.

description:
So excited that Neighbor has opened a storefront in my neighborhood! If you don't know, Greg Mindel's pastries have been stocked in A TON of coffee shops around San Francisco (Sightglass, Front Cafe, Contraband Coffee, and at Mr. and Mrs. ice cream).

In this store, he is serving his normal pastries (chocolate claw, kimchi buns), but he is also making new items like bread and cream and custard-based pastries. They are also selling coffee. This makes it the perfect stop before heading to the cal-train (tip for the people parking in my neighborhood to get to work). 

I first fell in love with his pastries when I found them at Front Cafe. If you haven't tried them yet, you will not be disappointed. My friend swears that this is her favorite bakery in SF. 

Right now they are only accepting cash and they stay open until they sell out (around 10:30). So, wake-up early, grab a delicious item, and enjoy your day!
author: Whitney E.

description: Hands down, the number one place to get the BEST croissant in the city. Definitely try the Everything Croissant and the plain croissant. It is worth the drive down here. Eat it immediately and don't try and savor it 5 hours later. I mean, it'll still be great, but not amazing! The first time I went, I bought a box to sample everything they made. Since I couldn't eat all of it, I decided to eat them later on. Bad idea. Baked goodies are meant to be eaten fresh. Period. Be warned, if you eat the Everything Croissant, be sure there are no seeds stuck between your teeth, because you'll sure be smiling after you consume one!
author: Ny H.

description: Pistachio croissant. Do it. So warm, buttery, and just perfect. Even after consuming a bowl of noodles for lunch, I devoured the croissant.
author: Diana K.

description: I first tried their pastries at Four Barrel and Sightglass and became obsessed. So if you don't live in Dogpatch or Potrero do not sweat- you can get at least the flavors in the Mission or SoMa.  Highly recommend the blackberry pistachio croissant! Incredible flavors.
author: Lauren W.

description:
Been getting their chocolate claw/croissant regularly at a local coffee shop so once I found out the guy responsible for them opened up his own shop just a few minutes away from me, I had to check it out. Now I'm in love with their blackberry pistachio croissant! I also recommend the ginger pull apart. Soo good. The bostock seems to be popular, but I wasn't really a big fan of it. Haven't tried any savory ones yet. 

Their coffee is not the best but that is not the reason to come here. Average price of a pastry is $3.50.
author: Zell C.

description:
tl; dr: best chocolate croissant in sf + super nice staff = GO TO NEIGHBOR BAKEHOUSE... NOW.

my diet starts tomorrow (yes, again), so i was determined to go out with a bang..... "bang" meaning "eating copious amounts of delicious baked goods," of course.

this morning, i dragged my 7 year old out to the dogpatch so that we could check out Neighbor Bakehouse and holy crap was it worth it. 

i am OBSESSED with bakeries, and Neighbor did not disappoint. everything we got was warm and delicious, like a giant hug from the pillsbury doughboy, but less creepy. we got:
* an apple and cherry turnover (yum),
* a sugar bun with some kind of ginger deliciousness (extra yum), and
* literally the best chocolate croissant i have ever had in my life (CRAZY EXTRA YUM)

after taking a bite of the chocolate croissant, my son said, "mom, you said this would be delicious, but it is actually super delicious!" he was right. 

not only that, but greg and his staff were so friendly and sweet - greg even let my son check out one of his machines AND push the buttons on it. +100 points.

i'm already planning my next visit and trying to decide which pair of elastic waist pants i will wear when i go back. it's that good. 

side note: they are currently CASH ONLY. if you show up with only $2 in your pocket, like i did, there's an ATM located nearby on 22nd street in Reno's liquor store. :)
author: Eryn K.

description: I can see why this bakery is so popular even on a drizzly gray Sunday. The ginger pull apart is amazing. Have it with a Gibraltar (cappuccino). You will not regret it. Service is super friendly.
author: Della Q.

description:
This place is awesome. Let me preface by saying that I'm SUPER picky about pastries. The croissants here are flaky and have a chewy, meaty center--exactly what I like and struggle to find in SF. The texture actually reminds me of Tartine's criossants but not as greasy. They also come in a good variety of savory and sweet fillings- ham & cheese and the pistachio were delish. My companions had one with sauerkraut and another with butternut squash that sounded interesting and apparently were super good.

To top it all off, service here is super sweet and very patient. Make sure you come early though- pastries fly off the shelf and this place just opened!
author: Nicole L.

description: I loved this place. Everything I've tried was delicious. Cheese and onion ctossant, everything crossant,   pistacio berry crossant are to die for. Fresh home made pastry and friendly people too. I am a regular there now. Parking is a problem though, they have only three parking spaces in front of their store.
author: Kim L.

description: O. My. Gawd. I can feel the fifth star bulging out and trying to pop out a sixth star! The pastries are dangerously delicious. So yummy you'll forget about your hawt fling last night. Be careful when you eat them, you'll be addicted and possibly will be attending pastries anonymous.
author: Pepe W.

description: Best bakery ever. Yes, this is in the same city with Tartine. No knock on Tartine, they are also at the the top of their game. Quality craftmanship and product. But NB has it in daring flavors, variety, on-point textures, and just friendliness. Great coffee too. Get it all. Take your time. I don't think there is a single bad thing in their repetoire. If it is not your thing, at least they get points for trying. Ultimately, the best maroons ever. Ultimately, the 5 stars don't lie. Any Yelp reviews under 3 are not to be trusted. As most places, weekend lines will be longer, parking can be a bit of a challenge because of the layout of the street, with metro tracks in the middle. And they close at 2pm. Don't sleep!
author: E. W.

description: Best croissants ever! All the other pastries are super awesome too. My wife had to buy one of everything.
author: Vinod P.
