description: Best bakery in town ! I always get the chocolate claw or the German pastry. It's next to my favorite pizza place, long bridge pizza. If you are in the dogpatch it's good to try out
author: Brian B.

description: Among the bakeries in San Francisco, Neighbor Bakehouse is one that may still be overlooked but definitely worthy of high praise. The croissants are flaky and buttery without being greasy or heavy. There are several different variations of the croissant - chocolate claw, everything, and pistachio blackberry. And while most bakeries offer mostly sweet options, Neighbor has a selection of savory slab tarts that are more similar to a croissant than what most people would imagine as a tart. There are two benches outside the storefront where you can enjoy your baked goods as well as a couple of parking spots for those who want to run in and grab a few things.
author: Mel W.

description: Cherries, almonds, buckwheat muffin-like thing this morning--OMG it was unbelievably good. And gluten free, though I could care less about that. Intense cherry flavor battling the intense almond flavor, soft buckwheat crumb, crunchy buttery almond top. The best.
author: Michele H.

description: phenomenally good pastries. Open super early, although sadly closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. Prices are actually semi reasonable for SF standards. Staff is super nice.
author: Fred A.

description: Super tasty and not too expensive (for the quality)  Both sweet and savory won our hearts.  I just wish they were open on Mondays (my day off).  The staff was super nice and even with a line out the door they moved it quickly and yet didn't rush you into decisions.  I can't wait to go back.
author: Monika S.

description: Nothing to complain, everything is so good. If u go on week day is so hard to find parking but less people. On weekend is much easier to find parking but long line
author: Angkana P.

description: When we first started coming here a year ago, we thought we found croissant heaven. Things have changed. Now the croissants are over baked, in my opinion. They are no longer golden, they are dark brown, even lightly charred at the top, giving it a burnt flavor. The inside of the croissant is not as fluffy and buttery as they used to be. Please go back to your original baking style.
author: ibby m.

description:
Maybe it was because my mom and I went into this establishment towards the end of closing (about 1:30pm) or whatever but the guy with some kind of hat who was supposedly helping us was very rude, sarcastic, and CONDESCENDING. 

My mom and I are all for reusing and everything and this guy didn't even ask us if we wanted to reuse a box where our pastries were going to be put in. My mom asked for a new box because she was planning on giving it to clients and under his breathe he said something along the lines of: most people like to recycle, and in a pretty rude tone . From the beginning he seemed like he was ready to get off work by lack of customer service he was providing us. 

This was my first time going into this establishment and am kind of disappointed in this one particular person. 

Pretty much everything is tasty, I prefer the stuff with guava, passion fruit, and chocolate for sure!
author: A M.

description: Almond caketart. I would definitely get a whole box of these! The passion fruit morning roll was also good but the almond caketart, wow. Crispy on the outside (kinda chewy) and soft on the inside - perfection!
author: Alrick F.

description:
Great pastry! Got there at 8 on Friday and there wasn't a long line - the line started when I was leaving at 8:30. We ordered the mushroom tart, ginger pull-apart, passion fruit cream-filled donut and latte. The tart and donut was yummy, latte is latte but the ginger pull-apart is what I'll be coming back for. The ginger pull-apart is glazed flaky pastry with a hint of ginger flavor. I highly recommend the ginger pull-apart.

Parking wasn't easy to find btw. Def ubering there is a better idea.
author: J I.

description: They ran out of everything around noon ish... We wanted the cheesey morning bun or something savory and there weren't many options left. I think we got the smoked salmon croissant but I didn't really taste any salmon in it?.. It was good but I should come earlier next time so I can get my hands on the real good stuff!
author: Michelle L.

description: The Neighor Bakehouse is incredible and offers a delectable array of bake goods ranging from sweet to savory.  My favorites are the Pistachio Blackberry Croissant, Passion Fruit Bun and Ginger Pull-apart.  Their lattes are great and they have community tables out front.
author: Lis A.

description: My new favorite bakery! UNREAL nummy nummnumm! The bostock and pistachio croissant are amazing and the mushroom tart, sublime.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Got the ginger pull-apart, the mushroom tart, and the blueberry pistachio croissant. All delicious! The pull-apart was my favorite- flaky and sweet, with only a subtle taste of ginger.
The outdoor seating is also great!
author: Amanda L.

description: Everything so crunchy, the ginger pull apart, crunchy.  The vegetable tart with roasted pepper, crunchy.  The sauerkraut,  crunchy.  The ham and cheese , crunchy.  Did I say the word crunchy enough.  How about, poppy seed.  Poppy seed makes it more crunchy.  Sesame seed makes it crunchy.  I see why so many people are in love with place.  It is far for those living near the other side of town.  They have a 72 hour pre-order via email, paid online.  Go to their website for their email address.  They sure work really late in the night.  I emailed around 6:40 am and they got back to me 10:00 pm ish.  The bad thing is that I have to pre-order again and this time I have to double my order.  Parking is far, but I realize there is a space in front after I parked two blocks away.  It's a tiny place, line out the door, but movement is steady.  Have your choices ready, but with much being sold out in the afternoon, there really wasn't much for the undecided. This place is a winner.  I would have taken a picture of the pastries, but my stomach won out.  Pictures of crumbs just don't get much "likes".
author: Helen L.

description: Just as you would expect your local neighbourhood bakehouse to be - relaxed, casual atmosphere with amazing pastries, sourdough bread and delicious coffee!
author: Elizabeth M.

description: Possibly the best pastries I've ever had. I highly recommend it to anyone who hasn't tried it. I would say the pastries at Neighbor are on par with the ones I had in Paris. The croissants are so flavorful, flaky, and crunchy.
author: Music K.

description:
Don't throw your croissant at me. I thought it was delicious, just not crazy amazing-must-consume-everything-and-bring-more-home. 
We went on a Saturday morning around 10:45 and I was fully expecting a wait, but there was none. So yay for that. 

We had:
- The Everything Croissant - really nice, seedy, little swirl of cream cheese inside. for tartness 
- Cheddar/Sauerkraut pastry - good, nice flakey, was hoping the inside would be tastier.
- Bostock Almond thang - THIS was awesome. Highly recommend. It had this delicious soft but moist bread and was unreal. 
- Ham and cheese morning bun -- this was supposed to be the same dough as the croissant.. but it was drier and not as buttery. 

Coffee was decent - a little small, as most hipster places go.
Nice little outdoor area with seating to hang out in on the sidewalk. So glad that this was added to DogPatch scene, love that neighborhood.
author: Subie C.

description: Hi! We have a suggestion for your Kimcheese toast! Fry the kimchi with some vegetable or sesame oil until it gets reduced, soft and caramelized (like your onions). Add soft boiled egg. It will really kick it up a notch. Other items we had - croque madame, mushroom toast, and various sweet pastries were very good. Soft boiled egg = perfect.
author: S. K.

description: We tried ginger pull apart the first time, then ordered t again along with German coffee cake the second time. Both of them are SO good. We'll keep exploring!
author: Hui W.

description: I've eaten everything from here. You pretty much can't go wrong with any pastry because every bite is flavorful and even.
author: Stef V.

description: Excellent bakery! A little out of the way but with the journey, twice baked pistachio blackberry croissant was the best thing I tried ($4). Coffee was great and nice clean outdoor seating area on a great day. We arrived at about 11:30 on a Sunday and there was a line out the door, but don't let that dissuade you, it moves quickly and the staff are extremely helpful and friendly! Enjoy!
author: Ray K.

description: Anytime I go. Everything I get. 5 stars flat. It is absolutely delicious. The ginger pull apart...the coco claw..the everything croissant..the scone...you name it! Do yourself a favor and get some of this in your belly! NOW!
author: Kevin G.

description: Absolutely superb bakeries! I prefer this place above 'b patisserie' and 'mr holmes'! Their twice baked pistachio raspberry croissant and chocolate was delicious with the right sweetness and green onion cheese croissant was so fluffy and not heavy at all. Feel the need to go here everyday
author: Zici L.

description: Delicious, delicious pastries - I stop by as often as I can when in the hood - the passionfruit thingy is the best. And the chocolate croissants. And ginger pulls. Best pastries in Dogpatch.
author: Sushi K.

description: Warning- this place is dangerously delicious! I discovered this place last week and I've been here 3 times since then.. This is going to be my new place to take out-of-town guests when I want to impress them with the gems of San Francisco. This place has a great assortment of sweet and savory pastries. I'd highly recommend the pistachio and blackberry croissant and the mushroom croissant tart.
author: Sarah S.

description: This place is worth the splurge! My favorite bakery in SF. I love the ginger pull-apart. The coffee is really great too.
author: Jennifer C.

description: This place is so dope. I've tried a significant part of their menu, and I think my favorite is the regular butter croissant. If I want something on the sweet side, I like the brown buttered hazelnut financier. It's so good! Although I do think their sweet pastries are a little too sweet, so I normally go for the more savory options.
author: H. L.

description: I love this place. Bought a croque monsieur and the pistachio/black currant turnover and it was divine! The egg yolk coming out from the middle of the croque onto the bread was so good. I can't wait to go back. I have had almost every item there and everything has been good, not to mention the service is great too.
author: Jason W.

description: I had the chocolate claw and a cold brew.  The chocolate claw was light and flaky and I was amazed to find that I could peel apart the flakes without having them crumble into hundreds of tiny flakes.  I like that the cold brew is sugar-free, which is not really the case at other coffee shops.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Came here because my sister wanted croissants from this place.

They close at 12 PM and I got here at 11:50 AM.

There was still a tray of butter croissants ($3/each), a tray of everything croissant ($3.50/each) and a few of something else that i didn't pay attention to.

Some staff members were heading out as i walked in and some were making dough (probably for the next day).

The staff are all very friendly and provide great customer service.

There is outdoor seating on the outside which is nice if you want to sit down and chat with a friend over a Cup of Joe and a croissant.

Their croissants are puffy and flaky. I liked it a lot but i think i need to try the croissant when it was fresh out the oven to give it another star.

Until next time....
author: Jan H.

description: One of the best bakeries in the Bay Area! If you are a croissant fan like me, this place is da bomb! We frequent this bakery almost weekly. The employees are also super friendly. Btw their bread and croque Madame is also amazing.
author: Uerica W.

description: Just awesome! Best pastries I've tried in San Francisco. We tried almost all of them :) they were delicious
author: Lidia M.

description: With 200 reviews and a 5 stars average I'm not sure I need to say it but hey, if you haven't tried this bakery yet, you reaaaaally need to schedule that. I tried once because it was on my way, now I don't hesitate to commute only to go there!!
author: Morgane M.

description: Golden!!! Devoured pastries while sitting outside, had to go back for second round it was that good!!!
author: Amy C.

description: All the pastries here are soo good! Both sweet and savory, you can't go wrong. You can also find them at some other local shops in SF but i'd recommend getting it straight from the source.
author: Mike P.

description: Meeting friends here and took the K opposite direction  i/o T so was late but once inside the bakery life was all right.  We ordered the ginger pull apart, the chocolate claw and 2 plain croissants.  Drove over to Blue bottle coffee and had our treats there.  Soooo good - the croissants were the best we've had in the city!  Bites between sips of blue bottle coffee made me want to move back to my city by the bay - sigh!
author: Jean Y.

description: Owner (I think that's her) is very nice. Last time we got a free pastry to try. The recipe has improved a ton, in fact the chocolate croissant is now at the top of my list. Definitely gaining popularity with long lines out the door now.
author: E T.

description: even on a rainy day, there was a line out the door.  i've had their pastries while getting coffee at sightglass, but this was my first time actually visiting the bakery.  i had the passionfruit doughp bread, and my friend had the pistachio blackberry croissant.  both were good.  their chocolate croissants are also very good.  there are so many things to try here that it's hard to choose.  just make sure you're not on a diet when you come here.
author: Helen T.

description: Might just be heaven.   * Croissants done.   It could rival any place in paris. I think they make the #1 quality baked goods in the city.  In fact it is heaven
author: RJ B.

description: Not at all surprised that this place pretty much only has 5 stars. Had the croque madame, and a single tear rolled down my face. It was so beautiful. Line was 7 people deep, but it took no time at all. If you go, go early so that the middle of the egg yolk in the croque madame is still super runny.
author: Ryan W.

description: We sampled three items (pistachio blackberry croissant), all of which were great. Our neighbor got a fourth item (ginger pull­apart)  which was also fantastic. My latte was yummy as well. No indoor seating, so come dressed to sit outside.
author: Crystal G.

description: The chocolate croissant is my favorite ever outside of Paris. Everything Greg does is amazing. You cannot do better for pastry.
author: Scott R K.

description: Special in flaky croissant-like bakery! Both savory and sweet are unique and well-thought. Hope they will keep their creativity up.
author: Tee P.

description: what a great place.  All of their pastries are top notch and I was delighted with the Everything Croissant.  Cheese and onion inside!  oh my...I wish i could have one everyday.  I think they are open for the perfect hours. Just the morning, until they run out of stuff.  Go early get your stuff and be happy.
author: Christian H.

description: Loved the light chocolate filled bun as well as their other tasty gourmet pastries. Always nice to get a peek of the open kitchen to see how the baking prep process goes down.  Cant wait to try their cheesy bread slice fixed with roasted veggies. It looked huge!
author: Rachel C.

description: This place is the bomb diggity. Almond blueberry croissant was amazing. I stuffed my with it in seconds.
author: Eric F.

description: Amazing baked goods!!!  One less star for the hours. I can never get there on time which is probably good since it's like crack and shouldn't be eating it anyway.  Great service too.
author: Elvis S.

description: The best croissant-dough based pastries in SF. The everything croissant is my favorite.
author: Amin S.

description: I'm not sure how they manage to get enough crack to put into all the pastries, but these things are addictive! The ginger pull-apart, the everything croissant, the assorted muffins -- all of it is thrilling. I actually find myself having little heart palpitations as I walk down Third Street from the Muni stop. Fair warning, this is the stuff you dream about. They are still in the soft opening stage with limited hours and limited offerings - but whatever you're able to get will be amazing!
author: Robert M.

description: The bomb.. My only problem is it's just too dang good and sorta overwhelms me and even though it's just a mile away, the parking is a bitch.
author: Paul F.

description: Even though I live quite far (it's a 50 min drive with no traffic) I try to go here as often as possible, and whenever someone comes to visit us we take them here for a Saturday or Sunday breakfast (keep in mind, though, that the seating is quite scarce, so don't expect to be able to sit unless you come early, wait or have luck on your side). I just love the croissants they make (they are a close second for me in the Bay Area), and the ham morning bun is really good.
author: Juliana D.

description:
I wish they had longer hours, but it is nice that they only sell things when they're fresh out of the oven!  You order things as they're still sitting on the cooling racks.  

Luckily, the line was only a few people deep at 8am on a Wednesday, and they do have coffee and tea.

Most things are viennoiserie based. I clearly had a hard time choosing, so I got almost one of everything...

- Butter croissant: it was a little less flaky than I was hoping for, but it looked beautiful, and I was eating it over 12 hours after it came out of the oven. It had just the right amount of sweetness and saltiness
- Chocolate claw: kind of like a chocolate croissant
- Pistachio twice baked croissant: I did not expect for a hint of marzipan (maybe honey pistachio paste?), but I loved itt. The crust on top reminds me of Chinese "pineapple buns", and the filling has blueberry to add some fruitiness without making it too sweet or tart. It sounded like a weird combination for a croissant but probably ended up being my favorite sweet thing
- Everything croissant: a savory croissant with a topping that's like an "everything bagel." It added lots of textures and flavors and was an interesting take on the croissant - I think I liked this more than the regular one
- Mushroom tart: another wonderful savory pastry. There was a lot of mushroom, and the slightly sweet tart base was a nice contrast to the cheese and woody mushrooms. This was probably my favorite savory item
- Ham and cheese morning bun: kind of like a ham and cheese croissant but better. The bun itself had the right amount of doughy sweetness without being actually sweet, and the nuts and seeds on top (similar to the everything croissant) added more texture. The ham and cheese were really good, and I wish there were more inside
- Sauerkraut tart: I like sauerkraut, and I like cheese, but maybe not the two together? The tart base held up well and had good flavor, but the red peppers and sauerkraut were a little too tart and sort of abrasive?  Otherwise, the baked cheese topping was nice

OK so maybe I went a little overboard with the ordering, but everything just looked so beautiful!  Each pasty is $3-4ish, but they're quite large, so it's nice to get a bunch and share with people. If you don't consume it immediately, everything is good if you re-heat it a bit in the oven.

There are parking spots out front, but those are reserved for the company next door, so you'll have to find street parking.  Previously, it was cash only, but they take credit card now!  This is definitely going to be a go to/destination bakery for me.
author: Marilyn T.

description: That everything croissant was EVERYTHING to me!! AMAZING!   I have also tried the ham and cheese bun, the ginger pull-apart, the brown butter cake, the pistachio-blackberry croissant ....  I think you get the point, I can't stop! Everything I have tasted from Neighbor Bakehouse is simply divine.
author: Allison V.

description: I just dropped my mom off at SFO and was headed back to Sacramento when I had a wild idea to find a delicious bakery on Yelp and pick up some treats for my guys back at home. Once again Yelp users pointed me in the right direction. Neighbor Bakehouse's delightful pastries really hit the spot. I picked up the sauerkraut smoked cheddar peppadew which my husband and I shared and it was so delicious I wish I wouldn't have disbarred. I can't write more because we are about to dive into the ham and cheese morning bun. We will be hitting up Neighbor the next time we are in the City.
author: R A.

description: Stopped in during a visit from Switzerland based on great reviews and ratings on Yelp.   WOW!  Had the ginger pull-apart for breakfast and the ham and cheese pastry for lunch.   Also grabbed a loaf of the sour dough.   Some of the best baked goods I've ever had - France and Europe included.  The sour dough has the most developed taste and best texture/crust I've ever tasted and the ginger pull apart was just amazing (the ginger was a refreshing alternative to cinnamon).   Buying "fresh off the sheet" here is the way to go.   A little off the beaten path but well worth it.   Thank you Neighbor Bakehouse for making my trip to SF really special!
author: Dave M.

description: I would give Neighborhood Bakehouse six stars if I could. Everything on the menu is amazing. My personal favorites are the Croque Madame, the mushroom tart, the sauerkraut croissant and the everything croissant. I've tried just about everything on their menu and everything has been spectacular. Best pastries in SF!
author: Ryan C.

description:
I thought I was in a sketch from Portlandia. If you want to line up for day old "croissants" served by surly "baristas" this is the place for you.

It's been open two months but it still hasn't managed to make enough pastries for the entire 6 hours, five days a week they are open but they do manage to not wake up early enough to actually bake their pastries and instead bake them the day before and FREEZE them. I guess it's too much for hipsters to be so authentic as to actually bake their pastries the same day.  

So to let's take a trip to hipster bakery shall we?

We get there an hour before they are suppose to close. The sign says they are open. I see the baker outside talking to some rich hipsters. We go and ask what pastries are still available. The barista's reply is what ever is out is what is available. OK. There is nothing on the counter but they are making some kind of weird oversized croissant. So we say we'll  take one of those. Surly barista tells us those aren't available, they are being baked for tomorrow. It's 11am and these are being baked for tomorrow? WTF? I'm confused and ask so you serve day old pastries, she explain oh we freeze so they are totally fine. Yeah cause what makes day old pastries even better is freezing them! I don't see anything else so we say so what you are saying is there are no more pastries left. Umm why the hell couldn't she just say that? We decided to just get coffee since we are there and end up with coffee with about half a shot of coffee in it, maybe they were out of beans too?

While we are waiting for the slowest coffee in the world a  group of young women come and not seeing anything ask if there is a menu of the pastries they do have. Surly barista replies we don't do that, whatever is out is what we have available. They look around a bit confused and I have to turn to them and say that they have no more pastries. One of the girls thinks I'm joking because she like most sane people assumes that the people that actually work there would say that. Barista girl just keeps on ignoring them. 

As we leave I see barista girl take two of the croissants that she claimed were for the next day and give them to the hipsters that are talking to baker owner. 

I don't feel bad I didn't try the pastry as I realized it's the same overpriced, overcooked pastry served at Front. 

And that folks is the very epitome of a douchy hipster business. I guess this is some joy in knowing that people paying insane prices for day old frozen pastry unless you are besties with owner and then you don't even have to pay!
author: DeathandFood H.

description: This place has to be the most amazing bakery I have ever experienced. I wake each morning telling myself, no!, you can't eat there everyday. But can I? I think about how many calories I have to burn off and if I run there and run back then I can offset the baked goodies.
author: James T.

description: I work in the area and this place turns out some of the most delicious pastries around. I had the Chorizo and Onion Tart, outstanding! It was so flavorful! I look forward to trying some more of their creations.
author: Daniel N.

description: I've tried most things on the menu here now, and everything is amazing. The chocolate pudding bun has changed my life--and I mean that literally--every weekend I get this insatiable urge to have one and I must go there. Also, the everything croissant...brilliant. Friendly folks, sunny outdoor seating.  This place is the best.
author: Gale F.

description: Any of the bread puddings and one of everything to-go please! On point! Cant miss... thanks neighbors.
author: Nathan E.

description: Mixed feelings about their pastries. The sweets were good, the savories were disappointing. The ginger pull apart was probably our favorite. Loved the crystallized ginger. The pistachio blackberry croissant was a close second. Unfortunately, that's where the compliments end. The ham & gruyere morning bun was scarce in both ham and cheese. There were virtually no layers in the everything croissant. They were all smushed into a compact, buttery yuckiness. Why didn't the layers rise? Didn't fold enough? Tried to bake with cream cheese inside? If you can't figure out how to get the layers with the cream cheese baked in, maybe you're better off baking sans cream cheese to get the layers, and then cutting open and stuffing with cream cheese. Speaking of cream cheese, it was scarce as well. Barely saw or tasted any. It needed about 3-4 times as much as was in there. Try again please.
author: Monty B.

description: THEIR EVERYTHING CROISSANTS ARE AMAZING. Wow I've never had a pastry this good, and I'm a pastry addict. This place is incredible!!!!
author: Kristen M.

description: This is one of those situations where you want to tell everyone how good the pastries are at Neighbor Bakehouse but you kind of don't, as the lines will start getting longer. Let's just say they have a great assortment of sweet and savory pastries. Period.
author: Anne K.

description: I love pastries and I love to get them here. I have been to all of SFs "best" bakeries and this is my favorite. I take everyone visiting here to try and it has become our weekend breakfast stop for the early morning trips out of town and often my only motivation for those early starts. I am certain that I have tried everything here by now and I have loved it all, though the blackberry pistachio croissant is what I recommend for the first visit. There is a small but fast line if you show up later in the morning but nothing like some of the other bakeries around, well worth it.
author: Braxton D.

description: I wish I could add more stars because this place is truly THE BEST! Super nice people and super yummy food! I've also noticed that a lot of cafes in San Francisco sell their baked goods so they're pretty popular.
author: Lamia A.

description: Chocolate claw (croissant) soo goooodd! My husband had the sauerkraut tart (sour cabbage + cheese) and he said it was very good. I was going to get another chocolate claw but rather got chocolate bun which was good too but nothing compared to chocolate claw. It had nutella type of thing in it. Will definitely come back! Yikilanziii
author: Merve A.

description: Sweet little bakery with warm vibe and picnic tables outside to enjoy the sunshine. Absolutely loved the veggie tart!
author: Feliz M.

description:
Oh my... I have mixed feelings about writing this review.  I want to acknowledge their amazingness, but also don't want them to become so popular that I can't get my pastry fix!  Ah well...  

This little gem is on my way to work, so those ill fated days that I have to go in on the weekend, I grab a pick me up breakfast from here.  Their pastries make weekend work totally worth it...  I'm serious.  It's that good.  

I am a total dessert and pastry snob.  Finally, I'm admitting that out loud (so to speak). I will wait in hour long lines to try a new place, bake at least weekly, and made a hobby out of visiting the best dessert places with a friend while living in Tokyo.  So I admit, I am a little critical.  With that said, I have to say neighbor bakehouse has the best best best croissant in the city.  Tartine is great, but can over bake theirs.  Boulange is still good, but can be on the bread-y side.  

These are the perfect, flaky, chewy, but crisp croissants that make me not embarrassed to say croissant with a correct French accent (or at least try).  We have tried everything and there really isn't a bad option.  It totally just depends on what you are feeling like.  The mustard in the ham and cheese morning bun is acidic enough to perfectly balance richness of the ham and cheese.  The chocolate croissant is a must.  The pistachio blackberry croissant is a really fun take on the twice baked croissants...

I could go on, but all I would be doing is delaying you from going there and trying them for yourself.  I will not do you that disservice.  In exchange do you promise to keep this our little secret?
author: L. W.

description: It is as good as the Yelp raving reviews. We loved every single pastry we got here. My goal is to finish trying every piece of toasty, moist, buttery goodness this month. And yes - the croissant is WAY better than Tartines.
author: Yvonne N.

description:
This is the epitome of what a neighborhood bakery should be. Reminds me of places we've visited in Paris where the owner is the one serving up the pastries.

We were out biking yesterday and decided to stop and check it out. I knew they had limited hours but just wanted to see the bakery (I used to be a baker so I'm kind of a bakery nerd). It was indeed closed but there was someone inside and she came to the door to greet us. Turns out it was Christine, one of the owners. She was so welcoming, invited us in, and offered us a couple of pastries and would not take our money. She said they would be donated anyway.

I was totally blown away, not only by the friendly attitude but the pastries were delicious. I had some kind of a crumb topped muffin and my husband had a croissant.

Will definitely make it a point to get up early and come by often.
author: Terry S.

description: This is easily the best bakery I've sampled in San Francisco. Ginger pull apart, pistachio blackberry croissant, and mushroom tart were all so amazing that I haven't been able to stray to anything else in the times I've gone back. What an awesome place, I wish I could work there so they would teach me their secrets.
author: Annie V.

description:
Wow, really great!

I became a Neighbor addict with their blackberry pistachio croissant at Four Barrel. That gateway drug has lead me to try lots of their goods, but there's still a ton I've yet to sample. So glad that I can now go directly to the manufacturer!

It's a bit tricky to park in that part of the Dogpatch, but it's worth the effort, IMO.

De La Paz on tap, too! They are all SUPER nice there, too. No attitude.
author: Jon B.

description: Actually open on Sundays! Awesome neighborhood addition. Pastries are delicious (had the Choco claw mm, ginger pull-apart mmmmmmmmmm, and ham cheese thing mmmm). I don't drink coffee so no idea about that.
author: Jeffry C.

description: I write this review having just finished my first (and definitely not last) pastry and coffee from neighbor bakehouse. The delicious creation was a puff pastry with kale, goat cheese, butternut squash and sunflower seeds. Unreal. This place is 100% worth the trek. Great coffee too, yay for having almond milk!
author: Eliza D.

description:
Excellent croissant - real croissant not the yucky crescent shaped bread that lots of places serve - these are the real deal! Buttery, flaky, yummy!
My 10 year old loves the chocolate claw. The ginger pull apart was great - very gingery, not sickly sweet. And we all liked the blackberry almond croissant. 

They're open Wednesday thru Sunday 6:30am until noonish. And they do accept credit cards. And they now have outside seating.

Coffee is good - but this is about the baked goods - you could always go across to Puccino and get a Sightglass coffee if you prefer.
author: Dean G.

description: I wish I could write two five-star reviews: one for the pastries and one for the staff. Both are truly incredible. I stopped in yesterday for the first time and everyone working there was so warm and kind. My husband and I had two pastries and coffee, each of which blew us away. Thanks for your awesomeness, Neighbor Bakehouse!
author: E A.

description: So good it hurts. Hours are highly irregular. You can find their stuff in coffee houses in city, but it costs more than buying directly from them. Would not go here if you're in a hurry. Parking in area sucks but worth circling. Usually a long line, but sometimes I get lucky.  Croissants are perfect, flakey and buttery. Do not eat in your car! ha. Love their savory and sweet inventions. I try some new weird item whenever I can, but mainly get the everything croissant, with chive and cream cheese, and morning buns. OMG the ginger pull-apart, beautiful. Yum yum yummy
author: SL B.

description: This place is amazing. Incredible pastries (savory, sweet, light, you name it), great friendly people, very reasonable prices, and great espresso. I can't recommend it highly enough.
author: Jordan R.

description: Best baked goods I ever ate. I read all the rave reviews on Yelp, and decided to give it a shot. Good choice, James (patting self on back...). The goods (we got a chocolate croissant, the Manchego and Mushroom, and the Everything Croissant) were much better than good. Real neighborly vibe to the whole thing, and excellent coffee. It's a little bit out of my neighborhood, but I can make the trek at least once a week...Go now before they get famous and the line is still pretty short.
author: James P.

description: Holy cow so this is amazing! Best croissants I've had since NYC and run by a lovely French lady;) you know it's legit!:D
author: Katie C.

description: Yum yum yum! Their chocolate claw is to die for. The best I have ever had, seriously! It's crunchy and flaky on the outside with a decadent dark chocolate vein that seems to be in every bite. Ask for it to be warmed up and they throw it back in the oven for an even crispier, meltier version. I've also had their Almond & blueberry twice baked croissant (or something like that) that was incredibly good. I've never seen a croissant that was crispy on the outside and almost cake-like on the inside. Parking sucks around there so I always walk but their seating outside is a great touch! Wish they were open everyday!
author: Amy M.

description: If the pistachio-blackberry croissant is any indication, the goods are passable. Overly sweet pastry with a dominant flavor of almond paste which hides any taste of pistachio or blackberry. Also a hard place to stop if you're in a car. The watery coffee is probably the only item resembling a French pastry shop.
author: Tiziana P.

description: Amazing pastries! Love the chocolate croissant and the mushroom tart. Thanks for joining our neighborhood!
author: Antoine A.

description: Well, I'm in the industry and I'm typically underwhelmed when it comes to places that receive hype and hyperbolic praise. This is not the case with Neighbor Bakery. This bakery is the real deal. It's hard to find the spot where talent and love for the craft converge so seamlessly, but they've accomplished that and with a big smile on their faces. Simple, unpretentious and outstandingly delicious. I will not go into the flavors, best to discover them on your own. I will only say, I've tried everything and nary a wrong foot placed...go now before it's too late and the clock strikes noon...
author: Brooks G.

description: More than anything you have to try the blackberry pistachio croissant. Who the hell else makes that?! I source this good stuff through Sightglass coffee on 7th and Folsom in SOMA. This is the real deal of bakeries in SF! The savory kimchee flaky buns are quite tasty as well...hmmmm...thinking of breakfast at midnight...
author: Christina H.

description: I'm in trouble!  A pastry shop just opened in Dogpatch and they are phenomenal!  I've already been 5 - 10 times and never had something I didn't want more of.  Both savory and sweet are very good.  They make good espresso, too!
author: Kevin M.

description:
Delicious pastries without the wait unlike a well known spot on Guerrero.

They have a selection of freshly baked sweet and savory goods plus loaves of bread.

The owner used to sell the baked goods out of Mr and Mrs Miscellaneous but now has his permanent spot.
author: Evan W.

description: Sauerkraut tart, with its hint of smoky flavor, was universally loved by our party of 6.  Ginger pull-apart was decadent.  Excellent selection of savory pastries.  Croque Madame was extraordinarily satisfactory in texture.
author: Carolyn S.

description: Definitely did not disappoint me!  The line was long but I have been wanting to try their pastries for so long so I stayed in line. They are so efficient that it only took about 10-15 mins. total. I was expecting way longer like B Patisserie. The ginger pull apart was amazing and a must get. Also got everything croissant, butter croissant, chocolate chocolate claw, pistachio blackberry twice baked croissant and a cookie. All were excellent. I wished it was closer to where I live so that I can go everyday for my pastry fix.
author: Mary L.

description: So so so so good! Ordered pastries for us and friends and almost ate them all before friends arrived (oh man!).
author: Redloci R.

description: A single bite to the Passion Fruit Doughp Bun and you'll discover the taste of travel, of discoveries, of new friends in new places. Moreover, the kindest staff ever!
author: Simona C.

description: I tried the Everything Croissant with cream cheese this week at Sightglass and now I can't resist getting it every day!!! Their pastries and treats are unique and delicious, I'm a big fan!
author: Marissa G.

description: Usually a very long line but it goes quickly and it's worth it!  Definitely a bit pricey but soo good  and a go-to for me! I had the Croque madam-delicious and different than usual because there was a hard boiled egg on top.  Yummy
author: Kiana M.

description: This place is legit. Everything is awesome, service friendly. Best to go with a bunch of people so you can try many things. Outdoor seating only, which tends to be cold in AM in the Dogpatch. De La Paz coffee.
author: F G.

description: Awsome Ginger pull apart! The large portion of breadpudding was really good too! Nice place for a peaceful brunch!
author: Anna G.

description: The bakery is outstanding! Pastries that are memorable. We met the owner when we visited. What a wonderful person, they were closing, but she insisted to come in.  It's probably the best bakery around plus great customer service.
author: Janice J.

description: Every time I hear a friend mention this place, I can't help but remember the trademark whiff of freshly baked pistachio croissants and my studious efforts to devour every single crumb.  No crumbies left when my fat clumsy fingers are done with it - that is a sign of a good pastry.
author: Josh Q.

description: Neighbor Bakehouse is amazing! When we want to treat ourselves in the office to a breakfast splurge we go for a big box of their amazing pastries. Be sure to try the ginger pull apart and the croque madame!
author: Laura L.

description: Best bakery in the city! Must haves include their ginger pull-apart and a cappuccino.  Perfect way to start the day!
author: Ula K.

description: Neighbor Bakehouse is now my favorite bakery in the city. I've never been disappointed.
author: Jack Glab 0.

description: This is my new favorite bakery, and I take bakeries very seriously. One of the best I've tried in the city. Friendly people, good coffee, nice place to sit outside, and amazing pastries. I just point to things until I've gotten a whole box of treats and then skip home with my treasures. Haven't tried the bread yet, but that looks tasty too. Everyone sitting outside eating their pastries is always in a good mood too (probably because they've got delicious baked goods), so there's a lot of positive energy overall.
author: Megan B.

description: Hands down the best croissant and pastries in the bay area.  Eating their pastry transports you to a different place.  We drive 40 miles to experience this goodness!  The owner takes his art seriously and to a high standard.  Just when you think the daily bake is quite an array of sweet and savory choices, he  comes out with something new and delightful to surprise you.
author: r h.

description: Emphatic 5 stars. Twice baked blackberry pistachio croissant was one of the best croissants I have ever had and certainly the best I've had in SF. Same for the chocolate croissant. Complement the amazing pastries with warm, friendly, attentive and competent service and you have yourself a legend in the making.
author: David C.

description: I tried 1 of everything and they were all delicious! My favorites were the everything croissant filled with cream cheese and the ginger pull apart bread.
author: Brian R.

description: a true rival to Tartine! every pastry we have tried so far is incredible and we are very hard to please after living on France. a few standouts are the pistachio blackberry, bostock, and the butter croissant. I'm a little worried that this place is two blocks from my house - it is the first thing I think of when I wake up on Saturdays and Sundays :)
author: Malarie J.

description: First time there today. We thought it was wonderful. These pastries are world class.  No point prolonging this review; no doubt 5 stars
author: Bradd S.

description: When my daughter and I are in the area, we like to stop by here. The food is great and always many items to select from. we are definitely fans
author: Joshua E.

description: We love Neighbor Bakehouse! Everything they make is delicious and the owners are really nice. It's our favorite SF bakery.
author: Christine V.

description: Their pastries are innovative and one of a kind.  We'd make a trip across town again.
author: ange c.

description: What can I say, I drive from Inner Richmond to Dog Patch. AND I'm willing to get up early to beat the crowds (only the weekend)...
author: Michelle S.

description: Arrived in the morning on Saturday, with no line what so ever. Ordered Bostock and Everything Croissant. Both were very tasty and at a much better price range than others with similar quality. Would definitely recommend to anyone who love pastry.
author: J Y.

description: I came back from a trip to Paris recently and realized my vacation turned me into a snob! The pastries and bread here just won't do anymore which bummed me out a bit since I love croissants for breakfast! That's when my friend suggested I try this place to soothe me until I can go to Europe again! OMG this bakery is life changing! Not only is EVERYTHING absolutely delicious (crunchy on the outside, just the way I like my pastries) everything is super fresh! I went in on my way to work to pick up a few things and the guy that was helping me said one of the items I wanted wasn't ready yet, then his coworker yelled from the back that he just pulled it out of the oven! It was still warm when I got to the office! MMMMMMMM The staff is also super friendly and oh so accommodating even taking the time to write down everything on the inside of the box so my coworkers would know what was what! My office fell in love with this place too! So far, I've been 3 times in one week! Only 3 cuz the weekend got in the way and they're closed Mondays and Tuesdays! But I'm looking forward to Wednesday when they open! I CAN'T WAIT! Btw, for all you Cubans....they have guava and cheese pastelitos here! My Cuban coworker gave her stamp of approval and asked that I get a dozen for her next time I go!
author: Gaile C.

description: Excellent chocolate croissant, very light and flaky and didn't feel greasy. I only wish it had still been warm so the chocolate would stay melted! Next time I would love to try the everything croissant. Wish it were open longer.
author: Chloe W.
